runners.name: Zoran
runners.comment: Solid over C&D, beat Robusto in January; lesser Lingfield run since; do better back here
runners.spotlight: Front-runs; reliable over C&D and after running well in a higher grade in December he took advantage of the drop in class in January, when fending off Robusto; brushed aside at Lingfield (has form on that track) in February but rested since and should give it a good shot back here.

stable_tour.quote: A scopey, athletic colt who did well on the Flat, improving throughout the year. We'll geld him and then get him over hurdles after Christmas. 16-11-20

He's a massive favourite because he loves going to the races, whether you put him in front of a hurdle or a fence or run him on the Flat. He gives his best every time. He's a better Flat horse than he is a jumper but as long as the ground isn't too soft, he'll still pay his way over jumps. We'll mix and match, depending on where the races are. I wouldn't be surprised if he got further than 2m4f over jumps. 29-01-25

runners.name: Robusto
runners.comment: Involved in tight finishes in 3 of his 4 runs this winter; tight with Zoran on C&D form
runners.spotlight: Often leads; involved in tight finishes on three of his four starts this winter and it should be tight between him and the winner Zoran on C&D form in January, when he just couldn't get past; set for a good show.

runners.name: Artisan Dancer
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
runners.comment: A 2m winner on Polytrack elsewhere; quite temptingly treated now but off since August
runners.spotlight: Has won over 2m on Polytrack elsewhere but his two wins in 2024 came on Tapeta, at 1m4f and 1m6f; had a quiet end to his latest campaign which ended in August but is quite temptingly treated again now; not ruled out.

runners.name: Rogue Tornado
runners.comment: Has won at 1m4f (turf) and 1m6f (Tapeta); not yet proved he's suited by 2m
runners.spotlight: Has done his winning at 1m4f (turf) and 1m6f on Southwell Tapeta; seemed a little stretched by 2m on the latter track in December and his stamina will have a workout with this likely to be run at a good pace.

stable_tour.quote: Another we acquired from Sheikh Hamdan's dispersal. This colt has a beautiful pedigree and is a fine, big specimen. He has done so well since we got him and is a beautiful mover. I'd imagine he will not be out until the second half of the season, but with that pedigree it will be next year when he will come into his own. I like him a lot. 30-03-22

runners.name: Cinnodin
runners.comment: Had few 2m runs on Polytrack; ultimately impressive in this last year; respected
runners.spotlight: Has had few chances over 2m on Polytrack but he impressed when beating Zoran in this race last year; two good efforts at Chelmsford (2m) and over C&D later in the year and although he hasn't shot the lights out in 2025 he'll be suited by the return to 2m; good run on the way.

quotes.race: Athlone Handicap
quotes.quote: Cinnodin didn't do much wrong at Wetherby, he was just a bit unfortunate in the circumstances. We thought this race might cut up and we had it as a plan a month ago. I don't normally like going a mile and three quarters with a three-year-old this early on but he would get two miles tomorrow as he is an out-and-out stayer - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's probably his own worst enemy. He keeps running so well and it's hard to find a four-year-old 0-80 2m race, but he'll go and win once he gets one of them with a bit of pace. 18-09-24

runners.name: Hebridean Nomad
runners.comment: Knocking on the door at 1m2f/1m4f; failed to find much over new 1m6f trip latest
runners.spotlight: Has led; sole win in 1m course novice as 2yo; missed most of 2024 but was knocking on the door at 1m2f and 1m4f until failing to see out the new 1m6f trip at Southwell in February; work to do up again in distance.

6:30.race_name: Free Bet With Unibet's Betbuilder Rebound Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Crack Shot
runners.breeder: Floors Farming & The Duke Of Devonshire
runners.comment: Worth a market check on stable/AW debut after six months off
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over 1m on turf for Ed Walker; picked up for 80,000gns in November and worth a market check on stable/AW debut after six months off.

quotes.race: Outdoor Digital Productions Handicap
quotes.quote: Crack Shot is a nice, progressive horse. Oisin muttered something about the Cambridgeshire or the Silver Cambridgeshire so we'll see where we go, but he's definitely on an upward curve. We've always wondered whether he wanted a mile and a quarter or a mile. We were one of those people who learned nothing at Goodwood where the ground was too soft. He just doesn't want it like that - Alex Cole, representing owners Jim and Fitri Hay, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He was disappointing in the Cambridgeshire last autumn and has taken a long time to come in his coat but he's a well-handicapped horse. I hope he can progress enough between now and June to get into the Royal Hunt Cup, that's the plan with him. 25-04-24

runners.name: Hieronymus
runners.comment: Handy sort whose six wins (disqualified once) have all come here; respected
runners.spotlight: Handy sort whose six wins (disqualified once) have all come here, the latest when scoring by a head over 7f in February; up 2lb and no problem with the return to this trip so is respected, especially if getting his own way in front.

quotes.race: Unibet Casino Deposit Â£10 Get Â£40 Bonus Handicap
quotes.quote: Hieronymus is quite a simple ride and it was just a case of going forward and we've got it very easy in front. We thought he'd stay the mile and he showed a good turn of foot from the front. He keeps galloping and saw it out well. It's great to be back - Nicola Currie, jockey.

runners.name: Racingbreaks Ryder
runners.owner: Cottier, Racing Breaks & Old Gold Racing
runners.comment: Didn't run very well in one go on the AW (Tapeta) so something to prove in the conditions
runners.spotlight: Mainly running well on turf in the second half of last year, including an easy win at Catterick (7f, soft) in October; has won after a similar absence, but didn't run very well in one go on the AW (Tapeta) so has something to prove in the conditions.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good shape and runs at Newmarket on Tuesday. He did superbly last year when he won his first three, but obviously that meant his mark shot up. He likes to get his toe in and might be at the top of his mark, but he's a year older, so he could easily have improved. 17-04-24

This genuine colt has given his owners a lot of fun since rounding off last season with victory in a Brighton novice. That earned him a rating of 79 and he hasn't stopped improving. First time out this year he won at Nottingham by a short head, followed up off a 5lb higher mark at Haydock and then put up his most impressive performance at Ascot over 7f when making it four in a row, this time off 90. He has been a joy to train and his work leading to this week has been as good as ever, so it's all systems go for the Britannia on Thursday, and rain would help him. He has form on fast ground but is such a tough horse that I feel the harder it is for his rivals the more chance he has. His key attribute is how he travels in his races and that will be a major plus for him this week. 21-06-23

runners.name: Pjanoo
runners.comment: Makes his debut for a new yard in a first-time tongue-tie; market useful
runners.spotlight: Made a successful reappearance at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) a year ago when trained by Richard Spencer, but below form in his last three starts and now makes his debut for a new yard in a first-time tongue-tie; market useful.

runners.name: Noble Order
runners.comment: Useful but has been hard to train; addition of a hood will need to have a dramatic effect
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come over 1m on the AW, including here, and he has shown useful form, but has been hard to train; faced an impossible task in a Doncaster Listed event on stable debut nine days ago and the addition of a hood will need to have a dramatic effect.

runners.name: Rogue Encore
runners.comment: Should be all the better for his return at Doncaster nine days ago; has run well over C&D
runners.spotlight: Won his first two starts at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) in November after the cheekpieces went on and he should be all the better for his return in the Spring Mile at Doncaster nine days ago; has run well over C&D and shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: This colt has a nice pedigree and he looks to have ability to match. His training is going very well and the plan will be to start him off in the next month. His work has been good and he will be another for the 'Rogues' to look forward to. 06-07-23

runners.name: Atlantic Gamble
runners.comment: Record in handicaps after his reappearance last year read 1111311; watch market on return
runners.spotlight: Record in handicaps after his reappearance last year read 1111311, three of the wins coming over this C&D; only up another 2lb, but the question is how ready he will be after 198 days off; the market should be helpful in that regard.

runners.name: Brasil Power
runners.comment: Three wins over 7f here; would have made more appeal at that trip but still frame material
runners.spotlight: Three of his four wins have come over 7f here; remains just 2lb higher than for the latest of those and the same amount higher than when runner-up in this last year; would have made more appeal at the shorter trip, but frame material all the same.

quotes.race: Unibet More Boosts In More Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Brasil Power was drawn 13 and George Boughey left it up to me. It was only in the stalls that I decided to drop him in and I'm surprised how quickly he got to the front. He's obviously a horse with ability and he likes the AW. It was a good performance - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

runners.name: Lessay
runners.comment: Record here reads 12221; may be best at 7f but still one to be interested in returned here
runners.spotlight: Needs luck in running which he didn't get at Southwell (7f) last time, but he isn't as effective on Tapeta whereas his record here reads 12221; may be best at 7f but still one to be interested in returned to this venue.

runners.name: Ata Rangi
runners.comment: Market useful on stable/AW/handicap debut after six months off
runners.spotlight: Made it sixth-time lucky in a Roscommon maiden (7.5f, soft) in October when trained by Henry De Bromhead; market useful on stable/AW/handicap debut after six months off.

runners.name: Enthused
runners.comment: Has shown little in three starts since returned to AW last month; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: 7-26 over hurdles and 3-15 on turf, but 0-7 on the AW and has shown little in three starts over a variety of trips since returning to artificial surfaces last month; best watched for now.

quotes.race: Friends & Family Remembering Norman Sharpe Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought the ground would be on the soft side for Enthused as he likes it rattling but fair play to him and he only ran on the Flat a week ago. Alex Chadwick, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Welcome Back To Ludlow Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's amazing, you can't top it. I had Enthused in my hands the whole way and his jumping is perfect. He doesn't get much height but he's very quick and he took me to the front and off we went - Jamie Gambin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Enthused ran well at Fakenham but got trapped on the inside when they had taken the last hurdle out and he was unlucky. He was given a great ride from Alex Chadwick and will run next at Fakenham's final meeting of the year next month - James Owen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by good friends of mine, the butcher Michael Clarke and the farmer George Wright, and he's a lovely little horse who cost meÂ£5,500 this time last year. He's run 17 times since then, won five times and earned just underÂ£45,000. He's ultra-consistent but very ground-dependent; he needs top of the ground. We probably shouldn't have run him at Cheltenham last time when the rain came. He had a history of breaking blood vessels but I hope we've sorted that outÂÂ we turn the horses out a lot and he's gained confidence. He's having a break and will be back in the spring. Two miles is his trip. 06-12-23

runners.name: Rhythm N Rock
runners.comment: 0-19 since winning over C&D as a 4yo; best watched unless the market suggests otherwise
runners.spotlight: 0-19 since winning over C&D on his 4yo reappearance and has shown very little since returning in September; best watched unless the market suggests otherwise.

7:30.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap

runners.name: Carbine Harvester
runners.comment: Needs a bit more again upped another 2lb but that's entirely possible; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Has progressed well since handicapping under Harry Burns in a tongue-tie, despite not always looking straightforward (has gone both ways under pressure and also flashed his tail); needs a bit more again upped another 2lb but that's entirely possible.

runners.name: Santa Savana
runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.owner: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: Highly tried after winning first time out last year; an easy 6f doesn't strike as optimal
runners.spotlight: Highly tried after winning first time out last season and is maybe best judged on her nursery fourth in the autumn (7f, soft); the hood comes off on her AW debut and an easy 6f doesn't strike as optimal against some progressive sprinters.

stable_tour.quote: She won on her debut at Leicester in May but then was very unlucky in the Empress Stakes at Newmarket last time. She was bunny-hopped in the stalls, got left and then consequently raced out of position, and came wide when all the action was down the stands' side. She goes for the Star Stakes at Sandown at the end of the month over 7f. She's a very nice filly and I'd expect her to be pretty good. 11-07-24

runners.name: Brosay
runners.comment: Ex-Irish; cheekpieces have helped; claims on his close second to Carbine Harvester
runners.spotlight: Cheekpieces have helped since coming over from Ireland, aside from a lesser effort when last seen 80 days ago; had previously come away with Carbine Harvester at Lingfield and is 5lb better off with that one, which entitles him to respect.

runners.name: Jewel Of London
runners.comment: Found the ideal opening when last seen; will find this rather more competitive
runners.spotlight: Found the ideal opening when last seen seven months ago (made all in a small-field novice round Wolverhampton); had gone the wrong way prior to that and will find this rather more competitive.

runners.name: Wheels Of Fire
runners.comment: Hung left a couple of times last season; needs to be more professional on comeback
runners.spotlight: Hung left a couple of times last season and pulled hard, racing away from the rest, when well held on his nursery debut latterly; will need to be more professional back from seven months off.

runners.name: Proudly Yours
runners.comment: May have needed her comeback for new connections but only looks to hold outside claims
runners.spotlight: Held in decent company after a debut win in Ireland last spring; may have needed her comeback for new connections back from eight months off (first-time hood) but, like stablemate Santa Savana, only looks to hold outside claims.

runners.name: Ardennes
runners.comment: Twice finished comfortably held behind Carbine Harvester; remains vulnerable to improvers
runners.spotlight: Better effort from the front over C&D in January but is fully exposed now, having previously twice finished comfortably held behind Carbine Harvester; remains vulnerable to improvers.

quotes.race: Danny McNab Bookmakers British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C & D) (Qual') (GBB) (Div I)
quotes.quote: We were very disappointed with Ardennes at Bath to be honest, he's sharpened up a lot. He's got stacks of speed and won that by burning them off early. Our two-year-olds have been going quite well, but they've all needed that first run. I think he's good, and he's only going to keep improving - Ed Walker, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Noble Victory
runners.comment: No excuses from the front in novice company (Tapeta) latest; needs more now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Built on a promising debut when landing the odds in decent style at Chelmsford second time; well supported but didn't look to have any excuses from the front in novice company (Tapeta) last time and needs more now handicapping.

quotes.race: Download The bet365 App Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Noble Victory did that quite nicely. It wasn't the greatest of races but he seems to have sharpened up from the last run. When I hit the front today he was still a little bit green and I had to give him a couple of reminders just to keep him awake on the job. He could possibly stay seven [furlongs] - Clifford Lee, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Pont Neuf
runners.comment: Won his first two last spring before struggling in decent company; looks exposed now
runners.spotlight: Won his first two last spring, including here, before struggling in decent company; returns from six months off looking exposed, having been said to have stopped quickly in a heavy-ground nursery when last seen.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Super Sprint [at Newbury on July 20] the obvious target for Pont Neuf. He's talented but a little bit quirky, so we need to manage him. It's difficult to give away a penalty but experience probably helped him on this ground - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet/EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C & D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mentally Pont Neuf isn't as straightforward as the one who won for me at Chelmsford on Friday. He has the ability to flip, but had never done that [was tricky before the race] at home. I've nothing in mind for him as I don't know if he'd cope with Chester's May meeting - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: Maui Breeze
runners.comment: May have more to offer now handicapping but needs to improve if she's to overcome stall 12
runners.spotlight: Progressed with racing last year, building on her clear Southwell second when landing the odds at the same course latterly; may well have more to offer now handicapping but she'll need to improve if she's to overcome stall 12 on her Polytrack debut.

runners.name: The Flying Seagull
runners.owner: Two Plus Three Two Plus Four
runners.comment: This mark within range but again might have been better drawn for one happiest in front
runners.spotlight: Has shown this mark within range in two starts back following seven months off; again might have been better drawn for one happiest in front but Oisin Murphy, who has a good record for the yard, is an obvious plus point.

runners.name: Tattie Bogle
runners.comment: Easier 6f may not be ideal (first two runs came over 7f) from a wide stall on comeback
runners.spotlight: Took care of a subsequent winner in a Tapeta maiden when last seen (since gelded) and remains unexposed; was allowed his own way in front at Newcastle, though, and this easier 6f may not be ideal (first two runs came over 7f) from a wide stall.

runners.name: Solanna
runners.comment: Four-time course winner; only been this far once; little wiggle room off this mark
runners.spotlight: Four-time course winner, latterly off 8lb lower in the winter (1m3f); continues in good form and has Billy Loughnane up (1-12 for the yard) but has only been this far once and there's little wiggle room off this mark.

stable_tour.quote: He got the season off to a fantastic start by winning three races on the bounce, which saw his rating shoot up from 47 to 68. I then made the mistake of giving him time off to strengthen up and I haven't been happy with his last three runs. I expected a big show at Wolverhampton last time but he was mid-division. I've been happy with him at home of late and I think you'll see a different horse next time. 23-09-22

runners.name: Foreseen
runners.comment: Better on his second run for this yard but will want to settle going up in trip again
runners.spotlight: Ex-French gelding who was wildly inconsistent for Adam West; did better on his second run for this yard last time but will want to settle going up in trip again.

runners.name: Nowhere
runners.comment: Maiden who ran two solid races in defeat for her new yard last month; should go well again
runners.spotlight: Maiden who ran two solid races in defeat for her new yard last month; twice finished second in C&D novices for Hughie Morrison last season and should go well again.

stable_tour.quote: She was second first time out at Kempton. She ran really well but, similar to Dashinwhitesargent, she came back with a dirty scope. 06-06-24

runners.name: Versatile
runners.comment: Ex-Irish maiden; undergone wind surgery since last seen five months ago; market useful
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who's undergone wind surgery since last seen five months ago; ran well here last September but will need a career-best if he's to take this.

runners.name: Laser Focus
runners.comment: Serial slow starter; did better back on turf nine days ago; AW record far from inspiring
runners.spotlight: Serial slow starter who did better back on turf nine days ago; was well placed to win three under both codes last autumn but his AW record is far from inspiring.

quotes.race: Clive Graham Memorial Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Laser Focus is in at Southwell on Friday and we might have to go again as he's won so easily. He's a good ground horse so it makes sense - James Owen trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's done well for us as a dual-purpose horse. He was a cheap purchase as we got him out of a claimer. He's won a good few for Pontoon Racing. He's currently on a break but will come back and have a spring/summer campaign. 01-01-25

runners.name: Golden Dove

prev_owners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton

runners.comment: Fair record here but has something to prove for her new yard back from three months off
runners.spotlight: Boasted a fair record here for Simon Earle but has something to prove for her new yard, back from three months off, having run poorly over hurdles a couple of times latterly.

runners.name: Imperial Cult
runners.comment: Behind Foreseen a fortnight ago; may need a bit of help from the handicapper now
runners.spotlight: Likes Lingfield and has gone well fresh before, so it was disappointing to see him offer little behind Foreseen a fortnight ago; may need a bit of help from the handicapper following three wins last summer.

runners.name: Dibble Dabble
runners.comment: Won second time out last year and has a fair chance of following suit upped 2lb
runners.spotlight: Won second time out last year and has a fair chance of following suit, having made an improver work for it on her Wolverhampton comeback; did enjoy the run of the race that night but goes on the shortlist upped 2lb.

runners.name: Birthday Angel
runners.comment: Regressive maiden who's found his level; stamina to prove back up from 1m2f however
runners.spotlight: Regressive maiden who's found his level now following a few runs over hurdles, latterly behind Egoiste; has stamina to prove back up from 1m2f however.

runners.name: Bye Bye Salam
runners.owner: D Smith & Hudson Plumbing And Heating
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in three runs, including two for Andrew Balding; yard been in great form
runners.spotlight: Has an eyecatching pedigree and was far from cheap but has been beaten a long way in three runs, including two for Andrew Balding last spring; yard in great form with jumpers but he needs a deal more now handicapping.

runners.name: Egoiste
runners.comment: Needs to settle better going beyond 1m2f for the first time but is one to consider
runners.spotlight: Has often worn a hood and will need to settle better going beyond 1m2f for the first time; he bumped into one at Chelmsford in February, however, before finding the race not panning out his way latest, and is one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: He's been the star of the winter, having improved 16lb in eight runs. We love him, but I think the handicapper was a little bit nasty by putting him up 8lb for winning at Wolverhampton the other day in a race where he could've been flattered. I hope he's right and he's a real improver who knows how to win races. I'm very proud of what he's achieved in his purple patch. 11-04-24

runners.name: Yes Sir
runners.comment: Gelded ahead of this handicap debut and is worth tracking in the market
runners.spotlight: Southwell fourth didn't amount to much and he's finished tailed off in two other starts; has been gelded ahead of this handicap debut, though, and is worth tracking in the market.

7:00.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap

runners.name: Strike
runners.breeder: S Emmet And Miss R Emmet
runners.owner: S Emmet And Miss R Emmet
runners.comment: Stable going well, but will need luck from the widest stall; opposed on balance
runners.spotlight: All four wins have come over 6f on fast turf, but he has run well over C&D; has been successsful after a similar absence in the past and stable going well, but he will need luck from the widest stall; opposed on balance.

runners.name: Future Cutlet
runners.comment: Still unexposed and makes his stable debut after five months off; market useful
runners.spotlight: Down Royal maiden winner (7f, soft) last September; ran well when fourth of seven on AW/handicap debut at Dundalk (1m, Polytrack) in November; still unexposed and makes his stable debut after five months off; market useful.

quotes.race: MadrÃ­ Excepcional Maiden
quotes.quote: I thought Future Cutlet won well. I had to make him work in the last furlong to get there, and he'll probably get further in time - Billy Lee, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Hodler
runners.comment: Modest in three AW starts and has no great record fresh; looks one for another day
runners.spotlight: All five wins over 7f on good or softer ground on turf; not set the world alight in three goes on Polytrack and has no great record fresh; looks one for another day.

quotes.race: Everyone's Turf Handicap
quotes.quote: We were delighted when it kept raining as Hodler is a different horse on this sort of ground, he quickens on it and picks up well. He could go to Epsom on Oaks or Derby day, there are races over seven furlongs and a mile and half a furlong. I just hope it keeps raining! - Jim Boyle, trainer.

quotes.race: Choose Dutemann Handicap
quotes.quote: Hodler is a nice horse and I've only sat on him three times and on all occasions he has won. He just got the ground he loves - Ryan Sexton, jockey.

runners.name: Arctician
runners.comment: Back off his last winning mark and has to make the shortlist under his optimum conditions
runners.spotlight: Again looked stretched by 1m here last month, with all six wins coming over 7f on the AW including four here; drawn wider than ideal, but is back off his last winning mark and he has to make the shortlist under his optimum conditions.

runners.name: Perennial
runners.comment: Has regressed since making a winning debut at Salisbury last June; hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Has regressed since making a winning debut for Ed Walker at Salisbury (7f, good to firm) last June, including in four starts on the AW (in this headgear combination) since joining this yard; hard to recommend at present.

runners.name: King Cabo
runners.comment: Both AW wins have come here, but will do well to win this on his first start in six months
runners.spotlight: Both AW wins have come over 7f/1m here; just 1lb above his last winning mark, but ended last season quietly and will do well to win this on his first start in six months.

runners.name: Berry Clever
runners.comment: Won twice over C&D in October; market useful back from 166 days off
runners.spotlight: Winless in his first 12 starts but ended last season with two wins over C&D in October; up just another 2lb, but hard to know how ready he will be after 166 days off; market may help.

runners.name: La Fleur Petrus
runners.owner: Chris Wright & The Grand Crus Lovers
runners.comment: 1-5 for Charlie Johnston; makes her stable debut after another 164 days off; market useful
runners.spotlight: 1-5 for Charlie Johnston, the win coming in a Southwell maiden (7f, Tapeta; first-time hood) early last year; makes her stable debut after another 164 days off having changed hands for 20,000gns in October; market useful.

runners.name: Al Ameen
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: Won well over C&D last month; up 6lb but still feasibly treated on previous form
runners.spotlight: Not prolific (3-31) but his record at this track reads 15244461 and he did it well when scoring over this trip last month; up 6lb but still feasibly treated on previous form if he has turned a corner.

quotes.race: Betway Median Auction Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Al Ameen was slowly away on his debut and he walked out again. They went quick and he warmed into it. He got his head down and he tried very hard. He'll stay further. The fact he could win after a start like that was very encouraging - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

runners.name: Chifa

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late J P Carrington

runners.comment: Ran a blinder after 472 days off when third at Wolverhampton a fortnight ago; respected
runners.spotlight: Five of his six AW wins have come at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta), but the other came over this C&D; ran a blinder after 472 days off when third of 11 behind a thriving rival back at Wolverhampton (7f) a fortnight ago and respected off the same mark, provided this doesn't come too soon.

runners.name: Mbappe
runners.comment: Off 138 days, but was returning from a similar absence when winning over C&D a year ago
runners.spotlight: Still 6lb above his last winning mark and not seen in 138 days, but he was returning from a similar absence when making a successful debut for this yard over C&D a year ago; each-way claims.

runners.name: Soar Above
runners.comment: Eight wins here, but losing run up to 28; best watched
runners.spotlight: All eight AW wins have come over 6f/7f here, but now at the vetran stage and losing run up to 28; best watched unless the market suggests a resurgence is imminent.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by a good friend of mine and is a good, rock-solid individual. He won on the turf at Newmarket last year and this term he was successful at Kempton on the all-weather. He's 2lb above his last winning mark and will win again. 23-09-22

runners.name: Stacey Racey
runners.comment: C&D winner; may have needed her reappearance but others are more compelling
runners.spotlight: 2lb higher than when winning by a nose over C&D last September and may have needed her reappearance here in February, but others are still more compelling.

4:53.race_name: Unibet Support Safer Gambling/EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Trad Jazz
runners.comment: Won nicely on her debut over 1m here last August; longer trip can only be in her favour
runners.spotlight: Sent off a weak 22-1 shot for her debut here (1m) last August, but ended up winning comfortably by almost 4l (race has produced winners); the longer trip can only be in her favour on pedigree and this 1000 Guineas entry should take all the beating if ready to go.

quotes.race: Unibet Zero% Mission "Confined" Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (No More Than 3 Runs) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Trad Jazz would run well. We don't turn the screw on these 2yos at home and we're learning as we go along this season with it being our first year, so a lot of that was natural ability, and she was professional. She's appreciated the surface and the mile. What she's beat I don't know, but it was a nice performance. We're treating the juveniles as 3yo types. They're horses for the future, so every run is progressive. She's going to come on a lot for that run - James Owen, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely filly who won on her debut at Kempton. I was going to run her at the back end in a Newmarket Listed race but she just wasn't quite right, so we decided to give her a break and she's done very well back at the stud. She's from a real staying family and I think she can make up into a really nice three-year-old. 01-01-25

runners.name: Personal Best
runners.owner: Hot To Trot 1 & Mrs R Pease
runners.comment: Made a winning debut at Leicester in October, but form hasn't worked out
runners.spotlight: 25-1 when making a winning debut at Leicester (1m, heavy) in October; bred to stay and stable going well, but the Leicester form hasn't worked out and she may find Trad Jazz a bit too strong.

quotes.race: British EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We had to talk the co-owner into running Personal Best. Dear Rosa Pease, she's been with me for 26 years and she's the breeder of Personal Best. She probably told me about six times not to run. Thank God the filly has done her well. I just thought they'd need the run today. On this [heavy] ground, you don't know quite what's going to happen. They've not had anything too demanding asked of them at home so I didn't have huge expectations -  Jonathan Portman, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's out of a staying half-sister to Annecdote, who Jonny trained to win at Royal Ascot. She's really nice but very much the type of big, scopey filly who'll be better with time and a trip. But she's showing up quite nicely. 02-08-24

runners.name: Chilli Queen
runners.comment: Just beaten at Wolverhampton last month and should win races, but perhaps not this one
runners.spotlight: Limited encouragement in two starts for Andrew Balding over 1m on Polytrack in the autumn, but much better when beaten half a length on her return/stable debut (same owner) at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) last month; should win races for her new yard, but is up against a potentially nice sort in Trad Jazz.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Marhaba Ghaiyyath was still a bit raw and I think she'd have been more streetwise if she'd had more of a lead. She's a bit weak and won't mind coming back in trip at the moment but, once she strengthens up, she should be able to go up in distance - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Belle Amie
runners.comment: Huge prices and has failed to beat a rival in her first two starts; possibly same again
runners.spotlight: Huge prices and has failed to beat a rival in her first two starts; possibly the same again today.

runners.name: Cantalice
runners.comment: Beat a total of one rival in two starts at Southwell last month; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Beat a total of one rival in two starts over 1m3f/1m4f at Southwell (Tapeta) last month; cheekpieces replace blinkers; may do better in handicaps after this.

5:25.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.name: An Bradan Feasa
runners.comment: Fair hurdler; some promise at Southwell latest; future lies in handicaps over further
runners.spotlight: Fair hurdler; recent Southwell seventh (1m) was promising enough to think he had a future on the Flat but likely it will be in handicaps over further.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Fred Winter is what we discussed two or three weeks ago. An Bradan Feasa would be 50-1 in a Triumph Hurdle, but although he will go up again today he would have a competitive enough weight in the Fred Winter. He will have a quiet enough time now and he will have one more run before March and see where we end up. He is very easy to ride, and Tom said he is an absolute delight. It (the Fred Winter) wouldn't be any bother to him. He has sat third there today and you could let him sit mid division to the rear in the Fred Winter and let him travel away  - Jack Jones, trainer.

runners.name: Dalton Park
runners.comment: Debut 5th here (1m3f) came behind useful rivals; open to plenty of improvement; down to 1m
runners.spotlight: 7-1 for his debut here (1m3f) 11 weeks ago, showing promise in fifth behind rivals who have franked the form; drops in trip but this isn't a strong race and he's one to note for market confidence.

runners.name: Mr Phillips
runners.comment: Showed nothing in a bumper at Huntingdon on last month's debut
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing in a bumper at Huntingdon on last month's debut.

runners.name: Skimming Along
runners.comment: Huge prices and just modest form in two 1m maidens this year; minor handicaps beckon
runners.spotlight: Huge prices and has run to just a modest level in 1m maidens here and at Lingfield this year; minor handicaps beckon.

runners.name: Tatmeen
runners.comment: Promise in two Lingfield runs last month but he'll face easier tasks when handicapping
runners.spotlight: Clear signs of promise in two Lingfield runs last month; another who may not flourish until handicapping.

runners.name: Almizan
runners.comment: Didn't live up to market billing in one run for Owen Burrows; best watched on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Only 5-1 for last summer's Windsor debut (6f, good to firm; trained by Owen Burrows) but she never made an impact, eventually finishing a remote last of 11; best watched on stable debut.

runners.name: Bannan
runners.comment: Big prices and well beaten in two AW maidens this winter; handicaps more suitable in time
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well beaten in two Polytrack maidens this winter; handicaps more suitable after this.

runners.name: D Day Major Winter
runners.comment: Tailed off on Southwell debut in January; gelded since; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Tailed-off last of six at Southwell in January (1m); withdrawn at Lingfield in February having bolted before the start; gelded since; too much to prove for comfort.

runners.name: Dixieland Blues
runners.breeder: Salabi Racing & Scea Ecurie De Montlehuc
runners.comment: Promising 2nd to a rival with experience on Southwell debut in December; sets the standard
runners.spotlight: Recorded an RPR of 83 when second of eight behind an odds-on winner who had the benefit of experience at Southwell in December; that form sets the standard and he's open to improvement; major player.

runners.name: Ernst Blofeld
runners.comment: Brother to Listed winner Jeff Koons; dam a Grade 2 winner; of obvious interest on paper
runners.spotlight: Third foal; brother to 1m-11.5f winner Jeff Koons (including Qatar Listed; RPR 106), closely related to 12.4f winner Autumn Winter (94); dam North American 8.5f/1m1f turf Grade 2 winner (109); appealing pedigree and one of the likelier winners.

runners.name: Gladius
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate Iv
runners.owner: Qatar Bs, China Horse Club & D Howden
runners.comment: 250,000gns yearling; half-brother to 7f/1m winner Lovely Esteem (RPR 98); appeal on paper
runners.spotlight: 280,000euros foal, 250,000gns yearling; fourth foal; half-brother to Irish 7f AW/Australian 1m turf winner Lovely Esteem (RPR 98); dam 8.6f-1m2f winner (including AW/Listed; 102); Oisin Murphy on board for debut; interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Hot Shot Lawyer
runners.comment: 100-1, green and never featured on Lingfield debut in January (1m); best watched
runners.spotlight: 100-1, green and never featured on Lingfield debut in January (1m); one for the longer term.

runners.name: My Kinda Ghaiy
runners.comment: Shown a fair level of ability in two Tapeta runs this year; each-way claims with a repeat
runners.spotlight: He has run to a fair level in two 1m runs on Tapeta this year; each-way claims with a repeat but others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.name: Yafaarr
runners.comment: Down the field in a 6f novice at Newbury last summer; should do better at some point
runners.spotlight: Only seen once as a 2yo, showing some ability in a 6f novice at Newbury in July but ultimately finishing tenth of the 11 runners; should do better in time but such progress is a must.

6:00.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.name: Kevano Breeze
runners.comment: Pulled up in two of his three bumpers and he struggled in both Flat runs in January
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in two of his three bumpers and he struggled at massive prices in two Flat runs at Kempton (1m3f/1m) in January.

runners.name: Midnight Ravens
runners.comment: Has already had three different trainers and he returns after another break; down the list
runners.spotlight: 4yo who has already had three different trainers; showed promise in first two runs before a tough assignment in hot novice at Newmarket (tenth of 14) last June but he returns after another absence and has quite a bit to find back on AW; gelded since last time; down the list.

runners.name: Arabian Force
runners.comment: Plenty to like on paper and he's an interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: Third foal; closely related to 6f-9.4f AW winner Smart Hero (RPR 103), half-brother to Listed-placed 1m-1m3f winner Sea The Casper (including KSA/AW; 112); dam unraced sister to 1m Group 1 winner Rizeena, out of half-sister to 1m1f Group 1 winner Zabeel Prince; looks the part on paper and he's an interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Booming
runners.comment: 135,000gns yearling; yard 5-19 with 3yos in maidens last year; watch market on debut
runners.spotlight: 175,000euros foal, 135,000gns yearling; first foal; dam French 8.5f 2yo winner (RPR 72), half-sister to winners Channel (French Oaks) and Paint (1m 2yo); yard 5-19 with 3yos in maidens last year and he needs watching in market on debut.

runners.name: Deep Water Bay
runners.comment: In rear in three runs at Southwell last month and handicaps will be more like it
runners.spotlight: Well-bred gelding but he finished in rear at big prices in three runs at Southwell (1m) last month; still very early days but he'll be more interesting when handicapping over longer trips.

runners.name: Explode
runners.comment: Drawn out wide on debut but he has a striking pedigree and is one to keep an eye on
runners.spotlight: 200,000euros yearling; third foal; gelded half-brother to winners Kitty Furnival (1m3f/1m4f AW; RPR 94) and Fusible (French 6.5f; 87); dam Group-placed 10.5f winner (106), out of French 12.5f/1m5f winning half-sister to 1m4f Group 2 winner Legerete; drawn out wide on debut he's bred to be useful and is one to keep an eye on.

runners.name: Fifth Column
runners.comment: Sets standard on close call at Chelmsford and he's a big player at new trip on his return
runners.spotlight: Four-race maiden but he was progressive as a 2yo and was only narrowly denied in a 7f Chelmsford novice when last seen in October (gelded since); sets the standard on that strong-finishing second and he's a big player upped in trip on his return.

runners.name: Keble Spirit
runners.comment: Down the field in both 2yo runs and needs improvement on his return; one of two for yard
runners.spotlight: Has useful pedigree but he's been well held in both runs in the autumn; shaped better than the bare facts when sixth of seven at Newmarket (1m, good to soft) last time but he still needs a big step forward after six months off; stablemate of Fifth Column.

runners.name: Mister Rizz
runners.comment: Has a striking pedigree and interesting to see how he figures in market
runners.spotlight: 425,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 1m2f/1m4f winner (including AW/Group 2; RPR 110), closely related to winners First In Line (smart 1m2f-1m6f) and Dawn Horizons (1m4f), half-sister to useful 1m/1m2f winner Burglar; has a striking pedigree and interesting to see how he figures in market.

runners.name: Prepare To Strike
runners.comment: Promising third on Southwell debut (1m) last month and he should know more this time
runners.spotlight: First foal of a well-related 7f/1m 2yo winner (including Group 2; RPR 114); never-dangerous on Southwell debut (1m) last month but he stayed on well to finish third behind two previous winners; should benefit from that experience and he's a likely improver on his second start.

runners.name: Sea Suite
runners.comment: 90,000euros yearling; yard 13% in maidens last year and market should guide on debut
runners.spotlight: 90,000euros yearling; first foal; dam 1m5f winner (RPR 64), half-sister to winners Ayrad (1m2f/1m4f Listed), Dawn Of Hope (9.5f AW Listed) and But Beautiful (6f-1m AW), out of useful 1m2f winning close relative of top-class sprinter Stravinsky; yard 13% in maidens last year and market should guide on debut.

runners.name: Surprise Again
runners.comment: Struggled in one turf run last summer and same story on stable debut in February
runners.spotlight: Struggled in one turf run for Richard Fahey last summer and same story on stable debut at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) in February.

runners.name: Topteam
runners.comment: Ran green on Newcastle debut last month and needs to leave that form well behind
runners.spotlight: Cost 125,000euros as a yearling but was a biggish price at Newcastle (1m) last month and he ran green before finishing seventh of nine; should know more this time but he needs lots of improvement.

runners.name: Zarakerjack
runners.comment: Well held in both runs this year and handicaps look the way forward after this
runners.spotlight: Well-held in two 1m events this year, with latest at Southwell last month; has shown ability but has quite a bit to find here and handicaps will be more like it.

3:15.race_name: Ashleybank Investments Reg And Betty Tweedie Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
3:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Music Of Tara
runners.comment: In good form until struggling in the Kim Muir and 3m2f was probably too far
runners.spotlight: Ex-Henry De Bromhead; made a winning stable debut over hurdles before a 2l third back chasing at Punchestown; this is easier than the Kim Muir in which she stopped badly and 3m2f would probably have stretched her anyway.

quotes.race: Navan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: John Flood from Boardsmill Stud bought Music Of Tara to breed from. He said he would give her a chance and see how she goes - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: TipperaryRaces.ie Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Music Of Tara really impressed in her jumping and hopefully she can go onwards now over fences and on the evidence of that she could well be a better chaser than she was a hurdler. I imagine she will stay going for a while over fences, she wants nice ground - Robbie Power, stable representative

quotes.race: Irish Daily Star Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought we were in trouble turning in but Music Of Tara stayed on really well. She just doesn't really travel but she's a really gutsy mare and Rachael was brilliant on her - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She ran really well in that competitive handicap hurdle at Navan on Saturday and I was delighted with her. Hopefully she'll get her head in front sooner rather than later. 20-11-23

runners.name: Cadell
runners.comment: Made it 2-5 over fences here last time and he remains competitively handicapped
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in the Edinburgh National but then made it 2-5 over fences with a game victory here over 3m2f; only 3lb higher and a tongue-tie is added; likely contender with Jack Power taking off 7lb (different rider claimed 3lb last time).

quotes.race: Ladbrokes 'Best Odds Guaranteed On Racing' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dropping back down in class helped him. He's a nice little horse. I feel sorry for Patrick on Your Own Story but Cadell probably had a little more toe on the day - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cadell is a horse we've always liked and we'd been looking forward to him stepping up to three miles over fences. He won two point-to-points and this was always going to be his game. You just dream that he'll eventually turn into a Scottish Grand National type, he likes good ground and stays very well. We're a long way off things like that but they have to be in the back of your mind, you can dream - Michael Scudamore, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He needs good ground, three miles and a staying track. He jumped very well on his chase debut and has the potential to develop into a Scottish Grand National type. 30-10-24

runners.name: Anglers Crag
runners.comment: Eider winner who is effective at this trip but his final piece of form is offputting
runners.spotlight: Overcame a serious late mistake to win last season's Eider at Newcastle (4m1f, heavy; 4lb lower), beating Prince Des Fichaux; signs of rediscovering some form when running well for a long way in the Edinburgh National (3m7f, good to soft) but ran no race in the Midlands version three weeks ago; has won at this trip but that latest effort is offputting.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Eider Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I said Anglers Crag was the best horse in the race. It was whether he got the trip. You don't know until they run. He's had a hard enough race. I'll speak to the owner but I don't think we'd go for a National this season. If he runs again he'll come back in trip - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Point-To-Point INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Anglers Crag works well and I would have expected him to win that in normal circumstances. He won his point well, he's a gorgeous big horse and just stays galloping. There's a 2m4f winners bumper at Leopardstown at Christmas we might go for - Terence O'Brien, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He won first time out over hurdles last year and then disappointed at Haydock. He loves soft ground and I don't yet know whether we'll stick to hurdles or go over fences, but he's got plenty of ability. 21-11-22

He's massive - he's like a tank. It's unbelievable how much he's thrived and how good he is. I don't think he would have come off the bridle in the Eider if he hadn't hit the second-last and it was amazing how quickly he recovered from it. Henry [Brooke] is brilliant on him as he's hard work in his races - when they go slow, he snatches at the reins. He's going for the Scottish Grand National and hopefully they'll go quicker at Ayr and he can settle a bit more. We didn't know if he'd stay when we ran him at Newcastle, but he stayed well. He's fast enough to win over less than three miles at Musselburgh and he tanked through the Eider - the trip doesn't seem to matter. All credit goes to Andy Robertson, who rides him every day, as Anglers Crag was a bit mad when we got him but now he's like a bus. He wanted to rush things, but he's a different horse altogether. He was screaming for his food the next day after Newcastle - he's so tough. The ground doesn't bother him, just sometimes his jumping frightens you - I think he likes a bit of room for his jumping. Like he did in the Eider, he'll bide his time and creep into it at Ayr. He's gone up the handicap but I think he's very good. 03-04-24

runners.name: Saint Arvans

prev_owners.owner: D Carr And Miss A P Lee

runners.comment: Won this two years ago and went in again that summer at Perth; he's back on a good mark
runners.spotlight: Won this two years ago and went in again that summer at Perth; he's back on a good mark and he can run well when fresh.

runners.name: Pont Aven

prev_owners.owner: Roderick Ryan & Thomas B Breen & M D Minch

runners.comment: Last year's pointing exploits didn't go that well and now returns from an absence
runners.spotlight: Last successful in a Ludlow hunter chase more than three years ago; last year's pointing exploits didn't go that well and now returns from an absence.

quotes.race: Vinegar Hill Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: He's honest anyway because, for a whole circuit, he didn't get a look at a jump but he kept jumping through. The loose horse went to run Dot Love's horse [The Mulcare Rover] at one stage but he jumped through again. The fences were the easy part - it was navigating the loose horses in between which was the hard bit - Paul Townend, rider

quotes.race: Welcome To Wexford Racecourse Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: He enjoyed the trip and seems to be improving all of the time. Hopefully there is a race for him at one of the spring Festivals - Willie is well able to find them. Hopefully he can win again - Danny Mullins, rider

stable_tour.quote: He goes for the 2m4f handicap chase at Punchestown next Saturday. 09-11-20

runners.name: Half Shot
runners.comment: Blinkers worked well initially but their influence seems to be wearing thin
runners.spotlight: Veteran who was 14-1 when partnered by Brian Hughes last time at Carlisle and finished well behind Ganapathi; blinkers worked well initially but their influence seems to be wearing thin.

quotes.race: James And Gloria Roche Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Half Shot was weighted to carry 8st 5lb at Newcastle (in the Rehearsal, with Shishkin compressing the weights), so we thought we'd come here. He won that well and jumped class there. I thought it was a great ride from Brian Hughes. I think this horse has got a good race in him, he's very consistent and genuine. He'll get a hike for that, so we'll have to look at better races. He ran in the Scottish National last season, so we could look at that again in the spring - Iain Jardine, trainer.

runners.name: Ganapathi

prev_owners.owner: W Duffus, K Jardine, R Griffiths
W Duffus, K Jardine, R Griffiths

runners.comment: Not as good as he was but has produced solid back-to-back efforts the last twice
runners.spotlight: Not as good as he was but has produced solid back-to-back efforts the last twice over 2m7f and 2m4f; good chance of being involved.

quotes.race: Wexford Racecourse Family Day September 3rd Novice Chase
quotes.quote: It was straightforward enough. Effernock Fizz was always going to go pretty hard in front and I was happy enough to sit behind her on Ganapathi. Every time she slowed up I went to her. I just tried to go an even gallop all the way - Kieran Callaghan, rider.

quotes.race: Freddie Doyle Memorial Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Ganapathi jumped great and there is room for improvement. I'd say the ground helped him as well and it's a help that he will handle that better ground. The fences have revived him a bit - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Sobac Soil.ie Used On Cork Racecourse Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: He missed the last but jumped very well in general. We went our own gallop and he kept it up. I think he'll improve for the run. The ground is very testing and with one going off in front like that, I thought it was a truly-run race - Paul Townend, rider of Ganapathi

stable_tour.quote: He's rated in the low 140s over hurdles but chasing could bring out more in him. That might be able to put him into good Graded company. Although he fell at the last when in the process of running a good race behind Gaillard Du Mesnil at Punchestown, he generally jumps well enough to improve over fences. 02-11-21

He's looked like he's going to run really big races and it just hasn't quite happened. We've changed things around a bit with him and the next time he runs we've got to give him every opportunity, with the right ground and trip. He's not easy to work out but we're beginning to understand him a bit more. 22-01-25

runners.name: Breakdance Kid
runners.comment: Enjoys good ground and returned to form with a solid third at Carlisle (3m)
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner who enjoys good ground and returned to form with a solid third at Carlisle (3m); off the same mark he merits attention.

runners.name: Prince Des Fichaux
runners.comment: Nearly won the Eider two seasons ago and was a 22l fourth in the same race on final outing
runners.spotlight: Nearly won the Eider two seasons ago (beaten by Anglers Crag) and was a 22l fourth in the same race on final outing; he is effective at this trip and could run well with a tongue-tie added.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Eider Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought we had it when Henry's horse made a mistake two out. Prince Des Fichaux did nothing wrong and Danny gave him a great ride - he did what he was told to do. He's run a blinder and I'm over the moon - Ewan Whillans, trainer.

2:45.race_name: Support The Injured Jockeys Fund Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
2:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Chapel Green
runners.comment: Below best last twice but on a competitive mark if running to anything like his best form
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner who is effective from 2m to 2m5f; last couple of runs over 2m weren't his best but did make a late mistake last time before weakening; on a competitive mark if running to anything like his best form.

stable_tour.quote: He was a pleasing second at Ayr on his hurdles debut, beaten a neck by the Gordon Elliott-trained Nonbinding, and on that run he looks sure to win a novice hurdle in the north. He's probably a horse for two or two and a half miles. 09-11-22

runners.name: Garde Des Champs
runners.comment: Consistent and wasn't done with when falling on his final run at Wetherby in October
runners.spotlight: Consistent gelding with form here and he wasn't done with when falling in a 2m3f handicap chase at Wetherby last October that was won by Cheltenham Festival winner Jagwar; the burning question is whether he'll be in the same form after his absence.

runners.name: Gold Des Bois
runners.breeder: Mme Joelle Brillet & Mr Michel Brillet
runners.comment: Has a good record here but all his best days have been over shorter distances
runners.spotlight: Has a good record here but all his best days have been over shorter distances and, now an 11yo, he's leaving it late to prove his worth over this far.

quotes.race: Kilmore Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He is a gorgeous big horse who will be a chaser in time and that was a good performance. The ground is lovely and a strongly run two miles is probably his trip. He has a very high cruising speed - Robbie Power, rider

stable_tour.quote: He got off the mark for us at Clonmel and the plan is to run him in a handicap hurdle at Down Royal. We'll keep him to hurdles for the season and hopefully there'll be a nice pot in him. 09-11-20

I was delighted to get Ray's [Anderson Green, owner] 500th winner with him at Kelso in November and then Musselburgh was just far too soft for him last time. He's very well handicapped and could definitely win a couple more races before the end of the season. He's having a bit of a break and will come back for a spring campaign. 22-01-25

runners.name: Andys Flame
runners.comment: Early days over fences and his fifth at Cheltenham in October (2m4f, good) reads well
runners.spotlight: 1-18 overall but it's still early days over fences and his fifth at Cheltenham in October (2m4f, good) reads well, with that race won by Topham runner-up Lisnamult Lad; respected back on good ground after a break with cheekpieces refitted.

runners.name: Fete Champetre
runners.comment: Form claims but recently withdrawn on account of good ground which is worrying
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 10yo; fair fourth at Sedgefield (2m3f, good to soft) in December on return from an absence and he was in front when falling two out at Ayr (2m4f, soft) a month ago; recently withdrawn on account of good ground which is worrying.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Four Calling Birds Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When Fete Champetre won his novice hurdle we had quite high hopes for him but he's not quite lived up to that unfortunately. He's had his issues and Rose has been very patient with him and given him every chance, so it's great to repay that by winning on him. Rose is ill today so can't be here but she'll be watching at home cheering on -  Jockey Craig Nichol speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fete Champetre is a nice horse, he won his bumper well at Kelso and we love him. We've schooled him over loads of fences to bring him back on his hocks a bit and it's worked. He's improved a hell of a lot from his last run and I hope he'll be a three-mile chaser next year. As long as the ground is all right he could run again this season - Tony Dobbin, trainer's husband.

runners.name: Restandbethankful
runners.comment: Went close on final chase run here in September and has been hurdling since then
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner, the latest at Cartmel (2m1f, soft) last August; also went close here off 2lb higher the following month and has been hurdling since then; respected with the return to further not an issue.

quotes.race: Breedon Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I'd love to say I gave him a peach of a ride, but Restandbethankful ran away with me. I rode him in work at home and he did exactly that, but you don't mind it when they're winning - Tommy Dowson, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran okay on his first start at Chepstow when he lacked experience. He works like he's on a decent mark and that run will have stood him in good stead. He's capable of winning on nice ground over hurdles. 21-10-21

He was a good winner over 2m at Huntingdon last time in a handicap hurdle and that form has received quite a boost with the runner-up, Zacony Rebel, bolting up last week at Ludlow by 12 lengths. There is a good handicap in two weeks' time at Musselburgh's big meeting that is his likely next assignment and off a 6lb higher mark he should continue to be competitive. 26-01-22

runners.name: High Moon
runners.comment: Not the most consistent and he's hard to win with at the best of times
runners.spotlight: Not the most consistent and he's hard to win with at the best of times; ran okay last time at Carlisle but no more than that.

stable_tour.quote: A horse with a great following at our local tracks. You can set your watch by him and come the spring, he should be able to add to his three wins. We've tried him up in grade and he gets found out, but the handicapper is dropping him a little bit now and that should make life easier. He jumps well and is a proper trier. 24-01-24

runners.name: Flash Du Pistolet
runners.comment: 9lb higher here in a more competitive race but he's got his tail up
runners.spotlight: Made all over 2m4f at Newcastle (good) and comfortably followed up over 2m1f here 16 days ago (good to soft); 9lb higher here in a more competitive race but he's got his tail up.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes 'Boost Your Bet Builder' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There's still a lot of improvement in Flash Du Pistolet, there's plenty of maturing still to come. He's definitely improved for better ground - Stuart Coltherd, trainer.

runners.name: Ozzy Cosmo
runners.comment: Only his third run over fences when not beaten far at Newcastle; had a wind op
runners.spotlight: Novice hurdle winner and still lightly raced; only his third run over fences when not beaten far at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) and he's had wind surgery since then; not ruled out.

2:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Sams Choice
runners.comment: He is down in grade off a reduced mark but reservations for now
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on his best form for Gordon Elliott but hasn't got a lot going for current yard; he is down in grade off a reduced mark but reservations for now.

quotes.race: Irish Daily Star Christmas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: In fairness to Jack (Kennedy), he said to run Sam's Choice in a big field rather than a maiden hurdle. He followed them around and it worked out well. He stays that trip well and I'd say he could step up further too. He's been a bit disappointing but winning today repays it all - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was just touched off at Downpatrick and qualifies for all those EBF races, so we'll find that sort of race for him. 18-10-22

He has the size and scope to make a good chaser. He was below par last time after running well on his stable debut, but he's working well and is ready to run again. I think he'll be better on better ground. We planned to go chasing with him but will probably wait to do that next season now. Hopefully he'll improve through the spring and he's getting well handicapped now. 24-01-24

runners.name: High Dancer
runners.owner: Advantage Engineering Ltd T/As Wrr Uk
runners.comment: Lightly raced and was well on top in a 2m5f good-ground maiden at Haydock 19 days ago
runners.spotlight: 3m point winner; lightly raced and was well on top in a 2m5f good-ground maiden at Haydock 19 days ago; brings potential into handicaps.

runners.name: Diamond Dealer

prev_owners.owner: The Boundary Stables Partnership ( C R Barber)

runners.comment: Did some late hanging but still ran well when fav for a Doncaster handicap last month
runners.spotlight: Did some late hanging but still ran well when favourite for a Doncaster handicap last month (2m5f, good) and good chance of being seriously involved here.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very good work horse - an absolute aeroplane at home - but sometimes it does look too good to be true. We ran him in a bumper at Ludlow in April and hoped it would be a walk in the park but he got interfered with, got very lit up and hung quite badly, eventually running out. The ground proved to be too quick for him at Haydock on his next start and his wind caught him out at Chepstow in a good novice hurdle on his return this campaign. He's had a wind operation since and hopefully that'll sort him out. We think he's very smart and, if he gets his act together, he could be pretty formidable. 30-11-23

runners.name: Kilbrainy
runners.comment: Both wins on good to soft but didn't run badly on good last time at Ayr; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Two handicap wins include one here and only 4lb higher than for the latest at Carlisle when edging out a promising horse of Olly Murphy's; both wins on good to soft but didn't run badly on good last time at Ayr; in the mix.

stable_tour.quote: He won well at Carlisle and then 2m4f at Ayr on good ground was just a bit sharp for him. He stayed on really well and just needs a bit further nowadays. He's having a bit of a break now and will come back for the better ground in hurdle races over 3m and a novice chase as well. 22-01-25

runners.name: Dollar Collar
runners.comment: Promising novice form last year but hasn't kicked on this season and needs a revival
runners.spotlight: Promising novice form last year but hasn't kicked on at all this season and needs a revival; possible ground issues as well.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Betting Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wanted to get the stands' rail on the run-in, so I thought I'd better go for it approaching the last before the leader shut the door on me. Dollar Collar is still a bit weak but toughed it out - Stephen Mulqueen, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Shoeshine Boy
runners.comment: Five-time winner but below par of late and would prefer softer ground
runners.spotlight: Exposed 9yo who has won five times over hurdles but below par of late and would prefer softer ground.

runners.name: Balcomie Breeze
runners.comment: Looked progressive until last time at Market Rasen and a case can be made
runners.spotlight: First run after wind surgery when winning well at Catterick (1m7f, soft) and bettered that form when second on his return visit (2m3f, good to soft); if forgiven his latest run then a case can be made.

runners.name: Half Track
runners.comment: Kept on for fourth over 2m4f at Ayr; cheekpieces removed but has had wind surgery
runners.spotlight: 2m5f novice winner; had a few chances in handicaps (including over fences) but he ran on well for fourth in a 2m4f handicap hurdle at Ayr a month ago; the cheekpieces tried there are now removed but he has had wind surgery.

runners.name: Evenwood Sonofagun
runners.owner: Mrs D Chapman & Mrs E Quinlan

prev_owners.owner: Frank J Lynch & Michael Hartnett & W O'Brien & A M Ryan

runners.comment: Recent win was at 3m and seemed to get outpaced back over 2m3f last time
runners.spotlight: Belatedly off the mark in a 3m handicap at Musselburgh (good to soft) and seemed to get outpaced back over 2m3f last time; better expected here.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Evenwood Sonofagun has been super consistent and ran a mighty race at Catterick where he jumped the last in front but ended up sixth. He's such an honest little horse and is the type who could benefit from a confidence boost like that - Lizzie Quinlan, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Wearelongterm
runners.owner: Dennis J Coppola & Mrs Dianne Sayer
runners.comment: A repeat of his second at Wetherby in January (3m, soft) wouldn't see him far away
runners.spotlight: Pulled up back over fences last time and ran poorly in his previous race over hurdles; however, a repeat of his second at Wetherby in January (3m, soft) wouldn't see him far away and he goes on good ground.

3:45.race_name: Scottish Racing Academy Mares' Handicap Hurdle
3:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Max Of Stars
runners.owner: Mrs S D Pearson & Ollie Pears
runners.comment: Returning to good ground won't harm her chances and cheekpieces go on
runners.spotlight: Won four hurdles during 2023 but hasn't offered much under either code this year; returning to good ground won't harm her chances and cheekpieces go on.

quotes.race: Smokey Joe Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Max Of Stars is a good mare and that's the best she's run. She's always been a keen-going sort, but she's never finished better than she did today. She's off to Wetherby now (for the Listed Wensleydale Juvenile Hurdle on November 3rd) and then she'll have a break. I can see her going back on the Flat in March before going back over hurdles and then we're thinking about maybe going over fences. She's a horse with a massive amount of upside and a lot of options - Ollie Pears, trainer.

quotes.race: Lee Pollard 60th Birthday Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That's a big chunk of an allowance to get [18lb]. Max Of Stars does have Flat speed but couldn't win on the Flat because she was too keen. She was keen today as well but enjoys jumping and is big for a 3yo filly. At Newton Abbot she ran away with me and had everything burned off by halfway. To be fair to them the opposition is fairly exposed today and she was the unexposed one - Brian Hughes, rider, speaking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Lexies Moon
runners.comment: Won at Stratford in October but well below that level on either side of a break
runners.spotlight: Won at Stratford (2m, heavy) on her second handicap start but well below that level on good and soft ground on either side of a break; needs to get back on track.

runners.name: Irish Lullaby
runners.comment: Flat/hurdle winner; one of her handicap efforts reads okay and she's back from a break
runners.spotlight: Triple Flat winner who has added two minor hurdles; tailed off in two of her three handicaps but was under 10l away in the other, at Aintree (2m1f, good) in November, and she could be interesting back from a break.

stable_tour.quote: We ran her back too quickly last time; she needs time between her races. She did a really nice piece of work on Tuesday morning. 16-06-23
She wants a really strongly run two-mile handicap on good ground, but when she ran at Aintree the other day they went no gallop. She's a 94-rated Flat horse, so she's got a lot of ability. 21-11-24

runners.name: Shes Notjoeking
runners.comment: Runner-up here three runs back when beaten just under 3l off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner; respectable efforts in her last three handicaps and was 3lb out of the weights last time (beaten about 10l); runner-up here three runs back when beaten just under 3l off the same mark.

quotes.race: Tay Valley Chasers Patrick Crofts Memorial Junior "National Hunt" Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: She's tough, she's very very tough. She's Notjoeking isn't very big but she's got a heart. She had a look coming down to the last which didn't help me. If she'd maybe galloped down to that  I think she'd have won a bit more comfortably - Patrick Wadge, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Blame Rose
runners.comment: She was pulled up at Newcastle on Saturday after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: The winner of two handicaps in the mud but was pulled up at Newcastle on Saturday after wind surgery.

runners.name: Holly Bird
runners.comment: Goes handicapping with a few questions to answer but retains some potential
runners.spotlight: Fourth of seven behind useful winner on hurdle debut at Ayr (2m, good to soft) in October but disappointing in her two runs this year (on soft which she handles); goes handicapping with a few questions to answer but retains some potential.

stable_tour.quote: A really nice mare from the family of Oscar Whisky and Seeyouatmidnight. She ran well in bumpers and was slightly disappointing at Ayr last time, but we're not sure if she stayed the trip. If it was soft ground, I could see her going to the Herring Queen Final at Kelso. We'll have to try to get her qualified, but it's big money and she could go well there. 22-01-25

runners.name: Tread Softly Now
runners.comment: Bettered her winning form when second after a troubled run at Carlisle; in the mix
runners.spotlight: 12lb higher than for her shock Ayr win in January (2m, soft; first-time cheekpieces) and perhaps bettered that effort when second off this mark at Carlisle (2m1f, good), especially as she didn't get the clearest of runs; in the mix despite the rise in grade.

runners.name: Winds Of Winter
runners.comment: Made the frame at Musselburgh last time (2m4f, good to soft) despite a late mistake
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden but made the frame at Musselburgh last time (2m4f, good to soft) despite a late mistake and is consistent in the main.

runners.name: Monteplex
runners.comment: Had wind surgery and goes in new headgear, all of which  offers some cause for optimism
runners.spotlight: Missed last season and needs to improve plenty on her three runs this campaign; has had wind surgery and goes in new headgear, all of which offers some cause for optimism.

1:45.race_name: Join Racing TV Now Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
1:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Go Go Chicago
runners.owner: Where It All Began Paul Hanagan
runners.comment: The Stratford race he won was weak and looks up against it with a penalty
runners.spotlight: Won an average Stratford novice for another yard last summer (2m2f, good) and bettered that form when third here in September; didn't look on a good mark for his handicap debut the following month and duly struggled; looks up against it with a penalty.

runners.name: Saracen Beau
runners.comment: Looked good at Ayr and unlikely he gave his true running in a Grade 2 next time
runners.spotlight: Won with a lot in hand at Ayr (2m, good to soft) and didn't appear to give his true running in a Grade 2 last time (soft); remains promising.

stable_tour.quote: A nice four-year-old who hasn't run and might go straight over hurdles. He's a big, galloping horse and, while he might win a bumper, I'd be inclined to let him learn his trade over hurdles as he's going along. 25-10-23

runners.name: Cloonainra
runners.comment: Irish raider with smart form and faces her easiest task for a while
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner in Ireland; below her best in a Grade 3 last time but was runner-up in a Grade 2 in January and then bumped into Tripoli Flyer at Musselburgh; faces her easiest task for a while.

runners.name: Gonnino
runners.comment: Just minor promise in two bumpers and was 100-1 when tailed off in a maiden here
runners.spotlight: Just minor promise in two bumpers and was 100-1 when tailed off in a maiden here.

runners.name: King Gold Boy
runners.comment: Few very positives to take from any of his runs and very opposable once again
runners.spotlight: Few positives to take from any of his runs and very opposable once again.

runners.name: Thunder Gap
runners.comment: 13-race maiden with a basement mark over hurdles and makes no appeal
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden with a basement mark over hurdles and makes no appeal.

runners.name: Wild Reiver
runners.comment: Finished last in his two bumpers (hooded for both) and brings limited appeal for now
runners.spotlight: Finished last in his two bumpers (hooded for both) and brings limited appeal for now.

runners.name: Good To Be Alive
runners.comment: In top hands and remains unexposed, especially under these conditions
runners.spotlight: Both runs on heavy; the odds-on favourite flopped when he won his maiden at Fairyhouse and was then last to complete in a Grade 3 at Naas; in top hands and remains unexposed, especially under these conditions.

runners.name: Top Flight Century
runners.comment: Placed once (1m4f) in nine races for Sir Mark Prescott and ended up in classified company
runners.spotlight: Placed once (1m4f) in nine races for Sir Mark Prescott and ended up in classified company; wouldn't be the obvious answer on this hurdling debut.

4:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Amma Lord
runners.comment: Competitive in recent points but poor form under rules and well beaten in this last year
runners.spotlight: Has been competitive in recent points but has poor form under rules and was well beaten in this last year.

runners.name: Deerstalker
runners.comment: Respectable form for Ben Pauling; made all in a recent point and should go close
runners.spotlight: Nearly won over hurdles a year ago for Ben Pauling and ran okay in his second chase for that yard; beaten by Theoldboggroad in a point in March but has since made all in another; should go well.

runners.name: Eagles Rock
runners.comment: Justified favouritism in two very winnable points last month and likely to need more here
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism in two very winnable points last month and he's likely to need more here on rules debut.

runners.name: Slaney Opera
runners.comment: Only 3-16 in points but those wins have come in his last five starts since tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Only 3-16 in points but those wins have come in his last five starts since the tongue-tie went on, accounting for Whatudoing in the penultimate one; chance.

runners.name: Theoldboggroad

prev_owners.owner: Mrs A Maclay & Mrs E Innes

runners.comment: Pulled up behind Whatudoing three runs back but only a 6yo and raised his game since then
runners.spotlight: Pulled up behind Whatudoing three runs back but he's only a 6yo and has raised his game since then; had Deerstalker back in fourth when winning a recent point.
