runners.spotlight: His two point wins were over two years ago and recent form does not bode well.

runners.spotlight: Well behind Slaney Opera when that one fell at Alnwick in February but he pushed the same horse close last month and now goes in cheekpieces; should be competitive.

runners.name: She Is The Enemy
runners.comment: Three heavy defeats in hunter chases include this race 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Three heavy defeats in hunter chases include this race 12 months ago; looks held by Slaney Opera and Whatudoing on this season's exploits.

4:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Ellistrin Bay
runners.comment: Second foal out of a 2m hurdle winner; stable 3-38 in bumpers recent seasons
runners.spotlight: Second foal out of a 2m hurdle winner and half-sister to useful 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner Shades of Midnight; stable 3-38 in bumpers recent seasons so probably best watched.

runners.name: Port Station
runners.comment: Related to winning jumpers and needs a market check with Brian Hughes booked
runners.spotlight: 11th foal; half-brother to winners Cango (2m chase), Devour (2m5f hurdle) and Marble Article (bumper); dam unraced sister to smart bumper and 2m3f-2m6f hurdle/chase winner El Vaquero; needs a market check with Brian Hughes booked.

runners.name: The Hatchet
runners.comment: Didn't quite get home on soft ground at Ayr and these drier conditions may suit
runners.spotlight: Bought for Â£105,000 after finishing second in an Irish point and travelled well before not getting home on soft ground at Ayr; predominantly Flat bred so these drier conditions might well suit.

runners.name: Golden Whirl
runners.comment: Weak 11-1 chance when last of five at Market Rasen where he also wore a hood
runners.spotlight: Weak 11-1 chance when last of five at Market Rasen where he also wore a hood (good); may improve on that but certainly needs to.

runners.name: Linsurge
runners.breeder: Joel Denis & Haras De Saint Voir Sca
runners.comment: 14-1 when beaten a long way on good ground at Wetherby and needed to show more
runners.spotlight: 14-1 when beaten a long way on good ground at Wetherby and needed to show more.

runners.name: Lester Mail
runners.comment: They went no pace here last time so he may have been a tad flattered
runners.spotlight: Seemed to show a lot more here last time out (soft) but they went no pace and he may have been flattered; however, he clearly has ability and this isn't a good race.

stable_tour.quote: All is good with him. He was entered at Newcastle on Friday but I didn't want to take a chance on fast ground as most of the family seem to prefer it a bit softer. There's a juvenile bumper at Wetherby on the first Saturday in December and he might well appear there. He's done a lot of jumping and it's not impossible he could go straight over hurdles for the National Hunt three-year-old hurdler series. I don't know if he's another Elvis Mail in the making but Ginger Mail wasn't either and he's progressed to a mark of 126. The family improves and I'd love to think this chap could be the same. He's got a bit of speed about him but he's quite weak. I won't be overracing him this season. 21-11-24

3:27.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStrick: 7.1)
3:27.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Mr King
runners.comment: Close third at Ayr last September and returns having had wind surgery; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Close third of 14 at Ayr (1m, good to firm) last September on his third stable start and perhaps soft ground was against him on his next two runs; reappears having had wind surgery and he's not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse who I bought earlier this month and he's settled in really well. He's a lovely, big, relaxed, long-striding horse who's won at a mile and run well at 1m2f and looks to have plenty of ability. Ger Lyons is a very good trainer and I don't know if there's a lot of improvement in him, but he'll give his new owner a lot of fun. He looks as though he wants good ground and a galloping track. I put him in an early-closing race at York and the Cambridgeshire could be a good long-term target. 26-07-24

runners.name: Barefoot Warrior
runners.comment: 2-3; has potential off his opening mark and he's firmly in calculations
runners.spotlight: Won at Thirsk (1m, good) last August on second start and followed up in Newcastle novice (1m, AW) in September; this unexposed 4yo has potential off his opening mark and he's firmly in calculations.

runners.name: Theme Park
runners.comment: Two wins from final five starts last term; improved for his comeback run last season
runners.spotlight: Two wins (1m, good to firm) from his final five starts last term; in the mix if reappearing at the top of his game but he improved for his comeback run last season.

runners.name: Austrian Theory
runners.breeder: Epona Bloodstock Ltd And P A Byrne
runners.comment: Won on penultimate outing last season but over 1m2f
runners.spotlight: Won at Pontefract (1m2f, soft) on penultimate outing last season and he seems versatile ground-wise; however, he got going too late when tackling 1m last year and could be vulnerable at this trip on reappearance.

quotes.race: Racehorse Lotto Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always thought a lot of Austrian Theory and he was a very talented two-year-old. I thought he was a real Golden Mile type for Goodwood last year but he can be a bit in and out. His run at Chester last weekend was a sign he was coming back to the boil and Joe Fanning was sublime on the front end. The straight track handicaps don't really suit him and, albeit the plan didn't come off last year, we'll be working back from the Golden Mile again - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a grand horse who we bought from the Horses In Training Sale in Newmarket. He's not quite ready to run yet, but we're looking forward to him this summer. I'm still learning about him, but I'd expect him to want a mile and good ground and to be running at some of the bigger meetings. 23-04-24

runners.name: Cruyff Turn
runners.comment: Might need this reappearance run but he's 3-6 here and is not discounted
runners.spotlight: 8yo whose reappearance form figures read 6680 so he may need the run; however, six visits to Redcar have yielded three wins; not discounted.

quotes.race: Host & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Cruyff Turn was eliminated from the Buckingham Palace Handicap at Royal Ascot so we came here as he likes the track and good ground. I hope this will give him a bit of confidence and we could aim him at the mile handicap at the Ebor meeting he won two years ago - William Easterby, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Clipper Logistics Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We swerved races at Ascot and Goodwood as Cruyff Turn loves fast ground. He's always been a lovely horse, he's a big horse who has just taken time - Tim Easterby, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's training well and we're very happy with him. He's just as good over seven furlongs and a mile, and he likes good ground and doesn't want it too heavy. 23-04-24

runners.name: Good Morning Alex
runners.comment: Form dipped last August-October, following prolific spell, but a break may have helped
runners.spotlight: Highly prolific between December 2023 and last June, winning six times; his form dipped in August-October but maybe a break will have helped and it's possible he'll rediscover his progressive ways on this comeback.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Global Stallions Handicap
quotes.quote: We were up 11lb in a better grade on totally different ground so we went with an open mind again and Good Morning Alex has done it well. He's been a real surprise package from going to the all-weather in December thinking it was a last-chance saloon. He's just grown up and matured. In fairness, he was a late foal but he's improved out of all recognition. Connor [Beasley, jockey] said he wouldn't want the ground any faster than it was today so I think a lot will depend on the weather as to where we go. This was very much the target - Nicola Barron, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Great Blasket
runners.comment: Runs off last winning mark and reappears with dual-purpose yard among winners on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Won four times last April-June and is back down to last winning mark; reappears with dual-purpose yard among the winners on the Flat; chance.

quotes.race: Follow Us On X @betrhino Handicap
quotes.quote: We'll check Great Blasket over tomorrow but as long as he comes out of the race okay I can't think why he wouldn't take his chance. He's a very hardy horse. He won first time for us and we probably didn't know how to ride him the next few times on the all-weather. Kieran Shoemark won on him at Southwell, where we said we'd drop him out and try to get there as late as possible, and since then he's won four from five. The change of tactics has definitely worked in his favour. I think stepping up to higher grade races suits him down to the ground, a harder pace and better quality of horses gives him a better target to aim at - Jamie Insole, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Great Blasket did that nicely and was tough. We were a little bit worried that the ground would be a bit sharp for him but Shane said he travelled around nicely. He'll probably step up to a mile the next day - George Murphy, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Barley
runners.comment: Ran well first time up last term and he's a competitive mark on the pick of his 2024 form
runners.spotlight: Ran well first time up last season and he's a competitive mark on the pick of his 2024 form; contender if fully tuned up on reappearance.

quotes.race: Jeffrey King Memorial Race Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Barley probably needed the run at Doncaster, not from a fitness point of view but to wake him up as he's very laid-back. We got a really soft lead today and were able to dictate. He's a lovely-looking horse and has a good attitude. He'll stay further and be better in a better race, where I think he'd be able to show his full potential - Rob Hornby, jockey.

runners.name: Empire Of Light
runners.comment: Often ran well last season (including over C&D); one to be interested in on return
runners.spotlight: Won at Haydock (1m2f, good to firm) last June on second stable start and runner-up four times subsequently last year, twice over C&D; he's one to be interested in on his return to action.

quotes.race: Black Type Accountancy EBF 'Confined' Restricted Novice Stakes (Run No More Than Once) (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Charlie said this morning that Empire Of Light was a better horse than the form of his first run suggested. He felt it was just too firm there for a big, heavy horse like him. He has gone well from the beginning to the end. That rain they had this morning has probably helped him as it was the extreme of conditions last time - Mark Johnston, joint-assistant trainer.

runners.name: Hale End
runners.comment: Two wins last season and his reappearance record suggests he could have a part to play
runners.spotlight: Last season ended tamely but he won twice in May/July (1m, good to firm/good) and has run well on his reappearance in each of the last two campaigns (failed to stay 1m2f last April); could have a part to play.

runners.name: Classic Encounter
runners.comment: 0-6 and doesn't seem straightforward, but peak RPR came on his sole turf outing
runners.spotlight: Ex-Godolphin 4yo who is 0-6 and doesn't seem straightforward (can hang); however, he's been given a chance by the handicapper and his peak RPR came on his sole turf outing; possible player now back on grass.

runners.name: Reidh
runners.comment: Below par at end of last season but has positive reappearance record and is well treated
runners.spotlight: Below par on final four outings last season but he won two in a row last summer and is back below his last winning mark; has produced positive performances on his last two reappearances and he's capable of a bold show.

4:27.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
4:27.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStrick: 7.1)
4:27.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Didaar
runners.comment: Had excuses for last 3 defeats; not ruled out back at 1m2f on good ground
runners.spotlight: Lost out narrowly in a 1m2f Doncaster novice (good to firm) on second start as 3yo and had excuses for later defeats, albeit was tried in a visor when last seen in October; gelded since; capable of better back on good ground.

runners.name: Capla Lazarus
runners.comment: Ran a cracker on 1m2f debut (good); had more to prove at 1m since; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Due to go hurdling at Christmas but he has a future on the Flat, having run a cracker on Beverley debut at 1m2f (good) and then had more to prove at about 1m on next two starts; interesting handicap debutant.

runners.name: Titainium
runners.comment: Soft ground not ideal on final 2024 start but is a C&D winner with solid claims
runners.spotlight: Soft ground was against him on final 2024 start but he'd previously progressed well in handicaps and was a C&D winner (good to firm) in August; solid contender if resuming at full strength.

runners.name: Mister Daydream
runners.comment: Won 1m handicap at Bath as 2yo; not go on from fair comeback in 2024; off since July
runners.spotlight: Winner of a 1m handicap at Bath (good to soft) as a 2yo; made a respectable return to action last summer but well held on next two starts and off since last July; market can guide back from layoff.

runners.name: Lechuga Lad
runners.comment: Pulls hard but even so he kept on well when 3rd on handicap debut (AW; about 1m1f)
runners.spotlight: Was hard to restrain with the hood left off (returns today) on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (about 1m1f) last month, though despite that, he kept on well in third; remains with some potential if he can only settle.

runners.name: Highwaygrey
runners.comment: Possibilities on best C&D form; respectable record on reappearance; in the picture
runners.spotlight: Five of nine 1m2f wins have come at Pontefract but he has possibilities on C&D form with Titainium in the autumn and his reappearance record is respectable enough to put him in this picture.

quotes.race: Pontefract And District Golf Club Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Highwaygrey likes fast ground and likes a stiff finish. He travels into it well and it seems to suit him this track - William Easterby, trainer's assistant, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Wayne Conway Memorial Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Highwaygrey has always been a handful in the gates but we just deal with it. He's got a bit of ability, it's just getting it out of him on the day - David Allan, rider.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Not for the first time Highwaygrey missed the break but I was able to travel there on the bridle so it was probably the right race for him. He's learning and we'll look to go up in trip with him - David Allan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He loves fast ground - it can't be too firm for him - and he likes to come off a strong pace, which he got when he won over 1m2f at Doncaster last week. 03-05-21

runners.name: My Harrison George
runners.comment: Campaigned from 1m to 2m in 2024, off the mark over the former trip; off since August
runners.spotlight: Campaigned over a variety of trips from 1m to 2m in 2024, breaking his duck over the former distance at Ayr in July; called it a day for the season in August but he was made favourite for his return last year (soft ground not ideal) so a good show could be forthcoming.

runners.name: Elemental Eye
runners.comment: Maiden; well held on AW of late; down weights and suited by these conditions back on turf
runners.spotlight: Maiden who hasn't been in any form on Tapeta this year but he's suited by these conditions on turf and is well treated on such as a Haydock second (1m2f, good) last July; turnaround on the cards.

runners.name: Kaaress
runners.comment: Off the mark on turf over C&D last May; see-sawed through the second half of the year
runners.spotlight: Added to three AW wins when off the mark on turf over C&D (soft; beat two rivals) last May; see-sawed through the second half of 2024 though and it's hard to know what to expect this time.

runners.name: Stand Strong
runners.owner: A Whillans, W Orr, C Spark, J Wright
runners.comment: Promising 2yo; missed 2023; modest in 2024 but down weights; could have a better year
runners.spotlight: Promising Godolphin 2yo who missed all of 2023 and had little say in handicaps for this yard last year; however he's dropped 19lb since August and could be set for a better time of it this season.

2:57.race_name: Watch Racing TV In Stunning HD Handicap
2:57.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStrick: 7.1)
2:57.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Toralou
runners.comment: Handicap debut; runner-up on two of her three starts and in excellent hands to progress
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on two of her three starts, on debut at Haydock (6f, good to soft) in July 2023 and at Newcastle (7f, AW) last month; begins handicap life on a good mark and she's in excellent hands to progress.

stable_tour.quote: She had a good first run at Haydock last summer in a race that has worked out well. She didn't run afterwards due to a small injury, but she's back in training now and we're looking forward to getting her out. 19-04-24

runners.name: Stratocracy
runners.owner: Total Asbestos Solutions Ltd & A Frost
runners.comment: Two wins from final four starts last year; returns minus cheekpieces but not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won at Ripon (1m, good) last August and returned to form in first-time cheekpieces to win at Southwell (1m, AW) in October; absent since and returns minus cheekpieces, but he's not ruled out.

runners.name: Roaring Ralph
runners.comment: C&D winner; some good efforts at Newcastle this year and could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who scored at Ayr last July and at Southwell (AW) in September, all in these reapplied blinkers; some good efforts in cheekpieces at Newcastle this year and could be thereabouts.

runners.name: Swiss Ace

prev_owners.owner: The Bottom Liners & Mrs R Carr
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Runner-up at Newcastle in January but hasn't scored on turf since 2020
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Newcastle (7f, AW) in January and some fair AW runs since; however, he's without a win since December 2023 and hasn't scored on turf since his debut in 2020; may find a few too good.

runners.name: Pallas Lord
runners.comment: In rude health on AW and won a division of this in 2022; respected
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Newcastle (1m, AW) last month and has gone close there the last twice (7f); rarely seen on turf nowadays but ran well last April on his latest grass outing and he won a division of this in 2022; respected.

quotes.race: Durdar Maiden Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: It was a taking performance by Pallas Lord as he's been on a massive learning curve from his first two runs. The stiff track and the soft ground have suited him - Harry Russell, jockey.

runners.name: Havana Prince
runners.comment: Won over C&D last July and this front-runner could bounce back to form with a bold bid
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on both outings this year but he returned to form on his third outing in 2024, and he won over C&D (good) last July on his only course visit; this front-runner could bounce back with a bold bid.

quotes.race: Amy Washbourne Bloom Digitally Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I would have been unlucky as I got hampered out of the gate and Havana Prince had to work hard to get into a good position. I thought we got racing plenty early and I needed the line in the last fifty yards - David Nolan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Highland Olly
runners.comment: Made debut last May; one win from his 12 starts; needs to reappear at the top of his game
runners.spotlight: 4yo who made his debut last May; won at Musselburgh (7f, good) last August and he can't be dismissed from calculations, but he's inconsistent and will need to reappear at the very top of his game.

runners.name: Quintus Arrius
runners.comment: Mark continues to fall but this regressive 5yo needs to halt the slide
runners.spotlight: Attractively handicapped on last year's best turf/AW form but he was well beaten in December on his last two starts and this regressive 5yo needs to be a different proposition on his return to action.

runners.name: Ideal Guest
runners.comment: Struggled on his three runs towards the end of last year, following an absence
runners.spotlight: Won twice in 2023 and his mark appeals on that form; however, following an absence he struggled on his three starts towards the end of last year and has plenty to prove.

runners.name: Ahamoment
runners.owner: D P Van Der Hoeven & D G Pryde
runners.comment: Found to be lame when down the field last time; good run previously; possible player
runners.spotlight: Down the field at Newcastle in January last time but was found to be lame; runner-up at Newcastle (7f, AW) 13 days previously and he won at Ayr (7f, good) last September; possible player.

runners.name: Heavenly Heather
runners.comment: Has shown ability on AW; improvement needed on handicap debut but it's possible
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who has shown ability in novice and maiden races at Newcastle (7f/1m), attracting the attention of the stewards two starts ago; improvement is needed on handicap/turf debut, but it's possible.

stable_tour.quote: She's a big, strong filly. Her dam won twice for Godolphin in 2018 and was rated 91 by the time she finished her career. She hasn't run yet but she'll be out at the back end of the season. 22-08-24

runners.name: Alfie Boy
runners.comment: Form went the wrong way last year but this C&D winner is down to a handy mark
runners.spotlight: His form went the wrong way towards the end of last season and he was pulled up over hurdles in November when last seen; however, his sole win came over C&D and he's down to a handy mark; perhaps the break and return to Redcar will trigger a revival.

runners.name: Yorkshire Glory
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo; fair reappearance at Newcastle; needs to build on it now back on turf
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who wasn't beaten far when seventh of nine on last month's return at Newcastle (1m, AW); could build on that run and the drop back to 7f may be a plus, but the suitability of turf is questionable.

3:57.race_name: Watch Live On Racing TV Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
3:57.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStrick: 7.1)
3:57.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Destination Unkown
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on recent belated debut at Newcastle but useful pedigree and could improve
runners.spotlight: 50-1 when soundly beaten fifth of seven at 50-1 on belated debut at Newcastle (1m4f, AW) a fortnight ago; however, he has a useful pedigree and improvement is possible on this second start; each-way chance.

runners.name: Reignman
runners.comment: Always behind on last month's debut; improvement is possible but necessary
runners.spotlight: 4yo who is half-brother to two talented sprinters; 10-1, always behind on last month's debut at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW); improvement is possible but necessary if he's to make an impact today.

runners.name: Miss Friday Lions
runners.comment: Has shown ability in bumpers; may need further on Flat but has each-way possibilities
runners.spotlight: Ran well when 50-1 for good Kelso bumper (2m, good to soft) 16 days ago on her third start; she may need further on the Flat but has each-way possibilities in a race lacking depth.

runners.name: Convergent
runners.comment: Won on debut over 1m here last October; has by far the best form in this field
runners.spotlight: 7-2 when winning in a big field on debut over 1m here (soft) last October; likely to be on different ground today but he's bred to be suited by the step up in trip and has by far the best form in this field.

runners.name: Asmen Warrior
runners.comment: Well beaten on debut but well bred and could be a different proposition at some stage
runners.spotlight: 50-1 when well beaten on debut at Salisbury last October (1m, heavy; gelded since); however, this well-bred 3yo could be a different proposition at some stage and is not written off for his in-form yard.

runners.name: Cameron Can
runners.comment: There's potential in his pedigree but well beaten last August/September on first 2 starts
runners.spotlight: There's potential in his pedigree but he was well beaten last August/September on his first two starts and has to leave that form miles behind.

runners.name: Colinski
runners.comment: Half-brother to two winners; in good hands; no surprise to see a big run on  debut
runners.spotlight: Third foal; Masar half-brother to winners Betties Boy (6f 2yo; RPR 85) and Bobacious (1m2f; 76); dam 6f-1m winner; represents up-and-coming Newmarket trainer and it will be no surprise to see a big run on debut.

runners.name: Without Burlington
runners.owner: Ms L G Robinson, J D Gunther & Partners
runners.comment: Well-beaten eighth on debut but attracted support and he has a useful pedigree
runners.spotlight: Well-beaten eighth on debut at Kempton (1m, AW) in December; however, he was backed into 9-1 and ran green, and this 50,000gns half-brother to two talented winners could pose far more of a threat this afternoon.

runners.name: One True Thing
runners.comment: Big odds and beaten a long way on his first two starts
runners.spotlight: Big odds and beaten a long way on his first two starts.

runners.name: Brave Emerald
runners.comment: Masar newcomer who may be of greater interest when tackling further
runners.spotlight: 12,000gns yearling; by Masar; closely related to 1m6f winner Big Cheese (RPR 74); dam 1m4f winner (87), half-sister to 1m6f Listed winner The Twisler; this newcomer may be of greater interest when tackling further.

runners.name: Highland George
runners.comment: 200-1 when well beaten on debut last October; gelded since; transformation needed
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Italian Group 2 winner and his stable is going well; however, he was 200-1 when slowly away and well beaten on debut at Southwell (1m, AW) last October; gelded since; transformation needed.

runners.name: Miss Raincloud
runners.comment: Debut wasn't devoid of promise but well beaten next time; perhaps best watched
runners.spotlight: Her debut at Carlisle (7f, good to soft) last July wasn't devoid of promise but she was well beaten at Newcastle (1m, AW) in September and is perhaps best watched on this reappearance outing.

stable_tour.quote: We got her from the Tattersalls October sales last year and she's a half-sister to the Britannia winner Khaloosy. She's had only one run for us, but it was a good one as she finished fifth at Carlisle in July behind Karl Burke's Serving With Style. She's a little bit weak but shows plenty of potential at home. 22-08-24

1:57.race_name: Flat Is Back On Racing TV EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
1:57.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStrick: 7.1)
1:57.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Ali Shuffle
runners.comment: Dam from talented family and top northern trainer does very well with 2yos here
runners.spotlight: 32,000gns yearling; by A'Ali; first foal; dam maiden (RPR 76) half-sister to winners Feliciana De Vega (1m1f Group 3) and Matsuri (smart 1m 2yo/1m2f), out of 1m/9.4f Listed winner; top northern stable has impressive 26% strike-rate with 2yos here in last five years; she's high on the list.

runners.name: Bleep Test
runners.comment: 1,000gns foal; half-sister to two winners; trainer's 2yos usually need their first run
runners.spotlight: 1,000gns foal; sixth foal; Time Test half-sister to winners The Organiser (6f/7f including 2yo; RPR 98) and Rosardo Senorita (1m 2yo; 77); check market, but trainer's 2yos usually need their first run; one of two for yard.

runners.name: Dolly Golightly
runners.comment: 25,000gns yearling; there's potential in her pedigree and she could have a part to play
runners.spotlight: 25,000gns yearling; eighth foal; Dandy Man sister to Qatari 10.5f winner, half-sister to four winners notably Deputise (5f/6f including 2yo; RPR 104) and Twaasol (6f-1m including 2yo; 95); there's potential in her pedigree and she could have a part to play.

runners.name: Maaleezmagic
runners.comment: Related to two winning sprinters; in good hands and she's one to consider
runners.spotlight: Â£22,000 yearling; fourth foal; Sands Of Mali sister to 6f AW winner Songhai (RPR 89), half-sister to 5f 2yo/6f winner Mercurial (89); dam 5.7f 2yo/1m winner (69); in good hands and she's one to consider.

runners.name: Piccalina
runners.comment: First foal; dam unplaced; wears a hood on debut and she may be best watched
runners.spotlight: By Ubettabelieveit; first foal; dam unplaced 5f (including 2yo; RPR 52), half-sister to three winners, out of Listed-placed 5f/6f 2yo winner; wears a hood on debut and she may be best watched.

runners.name: Lope Y Linda
runners.comment: Half-sister to two winners but she may be one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: 13,000gns foal; fifth foal; Lope Y Fernandez half-sister to winners Delphinus (French 9.5f; RPR 77) and Alizee (Italian 1m6f hurdle); dam French 7f/7.7f 2yo winner; yard runs two; may be one for further down the line.

runners.name: Muddy Nora
runners.comment: Sister to 7f-1m1f winner On Borrowed Time (RPR 68); others appeal more on paper
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; Land Force sister to 7f-1m1f winner On Borrowed Time (including 2yo; RPR 68); dam maiden (61) from classy family; others make greater appeal on paper.

runners.name: Peggy Boo
runners.owner: S Ullyott, T Coyle & P Robinson
runners.comment: Dam French 6.5f/7.5f winner (including 2yo); the betting may be informative on debut
runners.spotlight: 4,000gns foal, 10,000gns yearling; by Starman; first foal; dam French 6.5f/7.5f winner (including 2yo), half-sister to two 2yo winners; not ruled out on debut, for which the betting may be informative.

runners.name: Rotokura Belle
runners.comment: Â£3,000 yearling; half-sister to Listed-placed 5f winner but others are more compelling
runners.spotlight: 2,000gns foal, Â£3,000 yearling; sixth foal; Cable Bay half-sister to Listed-placed 5f winner Ardad's Great (RPR 89); dam 6f winner (71); other newcomers are more compelling.

runners.name: Sucking Diesel
runners.comment: Showed pace when close eighth in the Brocklesby and could put that experience to good use
runners.spotlight: 13-2, reluctant to load but showed good pace when 3l eighth of 17 in the Brocklesby at Doncaster (5f, good to soft) nine days ago; this half-sister to four winners could put that experience to good use today.

5:00.race_name: Watch Race Replays At racingtv.com Handicap
5:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStrick: 7.1)
5:00.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Salaria
runners.comment: Below best at 1m latest; promising 2nd over 1m2f on handicap debut previously; turf debut
runners.spotlight: Below best when returned to 1m on Newcastle AW 18 days ago but her previous 1m2f run on handicap debut there was more promising; should still have some potential at this trip now switched to turf.

runners.name: Magic Topissima
runners.breeder: E Lemaitre, C Lemaitre & Mme C Lemaitre
runners.comment: Easy to back and well held in two AW handicaps at 7f and 1m4f; new trip back on turf
runners.spotlight: Easy to back and has not looked well treated in two handicaps on Tapeta this year, over 7f and 1m4f; needs a lot more for the new trip and return to turf.

runners.name: Aurelius Maximus
runners.comment: Well adrift in AW events at 7f/1m; open to improvement now handicapping in ordinary race
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well adrift in AW events at 7f and 1m in the autumn but he's now qualified for an ordinary handicap and this longer trip should suit on pedigree; market can give an idea as to what's expected.

runners.name: Call Me Audrey
runners.comment: 33-1 for AW handicap debut (7f) and down the field; encouragement in pedigree for new trip
runners.spotlight: Big prices for all four starts and there was no improvement for the switch to this level at Newcastle (7f) in March; pedigree supports the move to a new trip though so she may yet do better; cheekpieces fitted.

runners.name: Hawkesbury Legend
runners.comment: Shaped well when 2nd on handicap debut (about 1m1f; AW) to well-treated winner; respected
runners.spotlight: Gelded after three minor 1m runs; up against it on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (extended 1m1f) in January when chasing home one who'd been hiding his light under a bushel but nevertheless showed more and this galloping track can suit; respected for yard that's 5-13 here.

runners.name: Owt For Nowt
runners.comment: Not yet shown much in handicaps; sold 1,000gns in November; new yard; lacks recent run
runners.spotlight: Has not yet shown much in handicaps, including at 1m2f, but at least she's eased a bit in the weights; sold for 1,000gns in November; has it to prove on return from a winter break.

runners.name: Precious Spartan
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Best handicap form when close 2nd over 1m in December; lesser runs since; new trip
runners.spotlight: Best handicap form when a close second at Newcastle (1m; first-time visor) in December but less to like about later runs, back to 7f with no headgear last time and now going the other way trip-wise; work to do.

runners.name: Hickton
runners.comment: Not gone on from fair 5f debut; plenty to prove back from break for new yard
runners.spotlight: Signs of ability on 5f debut for Kevin Ryan but he hasn't gone on from that, including in handicaps at 6f to 1m2f; needs to have come on plenty over the winter if he's to figure for new trainer; blinkers refitted.

runners.name: Spirit Of Murray
runners.comment: Beaten 20l+ in three novices; goes handicapping off plater's mark; check the betting
runners.spotlight: Beaten at least 20l in three novices at 1m and 1m2f but this well-bred 3yo goes handicapping off a plater's mark in first-time blinkers and this is much his most realistic task to date; check the betting.

runners.name: Cuda Been A Rowlex
runners.comment: Running-on 5th in 1m AW handicaps before never involved over 1m4f; this trip could suit
runners.spotlight: Hinted at better to come when a running-on fifth over 1m at Wolverhampton and Southwell; never involved when upped to 1m4f on the former track since but still early days and 1m2f could be more to his liking.

runners.name: Bear Baby
runners.comment: Fair 3rd in a slowly run 1m2f AW handicap; well held over 1m4f since; more to prove here
runners.spotlight: Appeared to improve on handicap debut when third at Lingfield (1m2f) but the race was slowly run; no joy over 1m4f since and others higher up the list; visor replaces cheekpieces.

2:27.race_name: Better Value With Racecourse Bookmakers Handicap
2:27.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStrick: 7.1)
2:27.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Keats House
runners.comment: No threat in either nursery but the first-time hood and step up in trip may be positives
runners.spotlight: No threat late last year in his two nurseries (6f/5f) but the first-time hood could help him settle better and his dam was a 1m4f winner, so the step up in trip may suit; returns with yard in good form; a possible.

runners.name: Ardaddy
runners.comment: Has shown ability but he finished last on his recent handicap debut at Newcastle
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability on 7f/6f on AW and this half-brother to a 1m2f winner could be suited by the step up in trip; however, he finished last on his recent handicap debut at Newcastle (6f, AW) and it's hard to be confident.

runners.name: Treble Winners
runners.comment: Well beaten on handicap debut last August and absent since, but has shown promise here
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on handicap debut at Carlisle (7f, soft) last August and absent since; however, he was a promising third here (7f, good) on the middle of his three maiden starts and is not ruled out now in cheekpieces.

runners.name: Groundhog
runners.comment: Hasn't achieved much but the first-time hood could help on this handicap/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Headstrong sort who didn't achieved much last July-September on his three starts; however, the first-time hood could help him settle on this handicap and seasonal debut and he's a possible improver; watch the betting.

runners.name: Rosezan
runners.comment: Fair fifth on handicap debut (6f, AW) and perhaps the step back up in trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Down the field on AW on first three starts late last year (7f/9.4f); not beaten far when fifth of nine on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in February and the dam's side of her pedigree suggests this step back up in trip may be a plus; not ruled out in first-time headgear on turf debut.

runners.name: Ottoman
runners.comment: 0-7 in Ireland last year but case can be made on best form; watch betting on stable debut
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in Ireland last year and well beaten on last two starts; changed hands for 11,000gns in October; however, he was a good third at Naas (1m, good) in September and a case can be made if he rediscovers that form on this stable and seasonal debut; watch the betting.

runners.name: Hill O Rue
runners.owner: Gordon Bulloch & S Hardcastle D Szepler
runners.comment: Improvement needed on handicap debut but has lowly mark and potential in pedigree
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in final third of last year on his first three starts and improvement is needed on handicap debut; however, he has a lowly mark and there's potential in his pedigree; no surprise if he takes a step forward.

runners.name: Sanbona
runners.comment: Half-brother to three winners but struggled in nurseries on his last two starts
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to three winners and he was a fair sixth at Ayr (6f, good) last July on his second start; however, he struggled subsequently (including in handicaps) and a major turnaround is required on his reappearance.

runners.name: Flamborough Head
runners.comment: Good third at Newcastle (7f, AW) recently and major player if seeing out this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Can be headstrong and there's a question mark regarding the step up in trip, but he was a good third at Newcastle (7f, AW) 16 days ago on his second handicap start, and he's also shown promise on turf; major player if seeing it out.

runners.name: Amber Honey
runners.comment: Yet to build on debut promise but things may well click again on this first handicap start
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for encouraging fifth on debut at Lingfield (7f, AW) in February; two lesser runs have followed (7f, AW) but she has a useful pedigree and can play a leading role if tapping back into her initial promise now up in trip in her first handicap.

runners.name: Hashtagnotions
runners.comment: Two wins at Newcastle from last four starts; strong claims if he's just as good on turf
runners.spotlight: Won at Newcastle (1m, AW) in December and returned to form to score there (1m) nine days ago; most of these have something to prove and he's a strong candidate if proving just as effective on turf.

runners.name: Heartened
runners.comment: Soundly beaten last August/September in her two nurseries and absent since
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten last August/September in her two nurseries (6f/1m); needs to be an entirely different proposition on this first run since.

2:35.race_name: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.name: Marbush
runners.comment: Unexposed gelding and he needs a close look now switched to a handicap after another break
runners.spotlight: Made it third-time lucky when landing a Kempton novice (1m) in August and he had an excuse on heavy ground at Bath (1m2f; lost right-hind shoe) in final 2yo run; gelded since and now returns after another break but he still has potential and needs a close look on handicap debut.

runners.name: San Juanito
runners.comment: Won novice here latest and he's open to more progress back in a handicap; key player
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when justifying favouritism in a novice here (8.6f) last month; nudged up 4lb but he produced a powerful burst to score in good style and is open to progress back in a handicap; key player.

runners.name: Lazieelunch
runners.breeder: The Pocock Family & Mr J Gunther
runners.comment: 3-4 on AW but was tailed off on turf in his final two runs last season; gelded since
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on turf (heavy/soft) in his final two runs last season and has been gelded since, but he is 3-4 on AW and his last success was over C&D in September; comes with risks attached on his return but could be dangerous if he can get back on track.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Lazieelunch won well at Kempton and the handicapper put him up 10lb, which we thought was a little bit harsh, but he keeps improving and quickened up really nicely off a strong pace - Sean Woods, trainer.

runners.name: Manara
runners.comment: 3-3 since switched to handicaps and last win was over C&D; respected back from short break
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-3 since switched to handicaps, winning at Chelmsford once (1m) and Wolverhampton twice (8.5f/9.4f); up another 7lb but she beat a subsequent winner last time and this progressive filly could continue on the upgrade; strongly respected back from a short break.

runners.name: Enrolled
runners.comment: 0-5 but he went very close here (8.6f) last month and looks interesting at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden but he's been generally progressive and went very close here (8.6f handicap) on reappearance last month; up 2lb but he didn't get the best of runs last time and he looks interesting at this new trip.

runners.name: Bentbasa
runners.comment: Flopped in final 2yo run and has a bit to prove in this competitive handicap on his return
runners.spotlight: Found improvement when a promising second in Newcastle novice (1m, Tapeta) in September but he flopped at Pontefract (soft) on final 2yo run; this is competitive on handicap debut and he has a bit to prove after 168 days off; has been gelded.

6:10.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap

runners.name: Saffredi
runners.comment: 5lb higher as he returns from six months off and will need to improve from stall 12
runners.spotlight: Suited by the drop to 6f when coming away with the favourite on his final start over C&D last autumn; is 5lb higher as he returns from six months off and will need to improve on that if he's to follow up from stall 12.

runners.name: Bomb Squad
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who's enjoyed a very consistent spell; no margin for error off this mark
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who's enjoyed a very consistent spell; there's no margin for error off this mark, coming back down from 7f, but he's more likely than most to give his running.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Rider Restricted Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bomb Squad is a superstar and he has been in spectacular form this year. He's run some good races over seven [furlongs] prior to this without winning so we were confident he'd get the trip and, to be fair to Cieren Fallon, he insisted we stepped him up to seven - John Mackie, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Alafdhal
runners.comment: Hard to win with but capable off this mark if the new headgear combination does the trick
runners.spotlight: Hard to win with these days but last Monday's C&D fifth was a bit better than it looked and he's capable off this mark if the new headgear combination does the trick; trainer also saddles Global Effort.

quotes.race: Support The Injured Jockeys Fund Handicap
quotes.quote: They went hard up front which helped Alafdhal and the race fell apart. That's four from four around here now and he's done well to come through as he has had his health issues and has also had me running him over the wrong trip - Phil McEntee, trainer.

runners.name: White Umbrella
runners.comment: Came to hand early last spring and is a dual C&D winner; there are reasons for optimism
runners.spotlight: Came to hand early last spring and is a dual C&D winner; there are reasons for optimism then under Hollie Doyle, who's 2-11 for the yard.

quotes.race: Join Our Bet Club At Vickers.Bet Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: White Umbrella relaxed well today and I allowed her to find her feet. She quickened nicely and it was quite a nice performance. She did everything right, but it was only the last half-furlong I thought I'd win. I'm sure she'd get a mile, although I'd be happy to see her over seven next time - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.name: Some Nightmare
runners.owner: Mrs S M Maine & Roger Gould & Partner

prev_owners.owner: Mrs S M Maine & The Cross Racing Club
N G H Ayliffe,Mrs S M Maine & Partner

runners.comment: Fair comeback five weeks ago but the combination of 6f and stall 11 doesn't look ideal
runners.spotlight: Has done a lot of his winning in the spring/autumn, including over C&D; made a fair comeback five weeks ago but the combination of 6f and stall 11 doesn't look ideal.

runners.name: Nubough
runners.comment: Long time since he ran on Tapeta and, unsurprisingly given his age, lacks consistency now
runners.spotlight: Improved an ordinary strike-rate when getting up in a busy finish to beat Papa Don't Preach at Chelmsford a month ago; a 2lb rise is fair but it's a long time since he ran on Tapeta and, unsurprisingly given his age, he's lacked consistency in recent times.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca-Fenwa Handicap
quotes.quote: It's well deserved as it's been over two years since Nubough got his head in front, but it wasn't for the lack of trying. He's been drawn in the car park and second several times. A few people called him some names but he's too stupid to run a bad race. He doesn't enjoy running around here and it was vital for him to get a decent draw. He has that stamina and was always going to run them down in the straight - Mark Pattinson, trainer.

quotes.race: Read Katie Walsh On Betway Insider Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Nubough normally likes a lead but he jumped well and no-one wanted to go on so I kind of had no choice as he's a strong-travelling horse. He didn't handle the bend too well and was hanging off to his right because of the tightness of the track. There was no pace and we just managed to hold on for as long as possible - Joshua Bryan, jockey.

runners.name: Radiant Angel
runners.comment: Another fair effort behind old rival Papa Don't Preach here latest; should go well
runners.spotlight: Edged out two of today's rivals when off the mark over C&D in February off 3lb lower; ran to a similar level behind old rival Papa Don't Preach here latest and should go well once more.

runners.name: Papa Dont Preach

prev_owners.owner: Kevin Frost Racing Club & David Orr

runners.comment: Long odds-on to both blow the start and pull hard, but threatening since upped from 5f
runners.spotlight: Long odds-on to both fluff the start and pull hard, so it's no surprise he boasts a poor strike-rate, despite being useful in his younger days; he's been threatening since upped from 5f, though, and will be popular again.

runners.name: Autumn Angel
runners.comment: Two winter C&D wins came off much lower marks and there's little wiggle room
runners.spotlight: Got upset in the stalls here last time and that's best overlooked; is well drawn for one happiest on the sharp end too, but her two winter C&D wins came off much lower marks and there's little wiggle room.

runners.name: Outer Edge
runners.owner: Int Plywood (Lmporters) Ltd And C Mason
runners.comment: Has hung left under pressure several times, so stall 13 can only look a handicap
runners.spotlight: Has hung left under pressure several times, so stall 13 can only look a handicap for a yard yet to get going for the year; otherwise he went close over C&D back from a similar break last November.

runners.name: State Of Madness
runners.comment: Hasn't had much luck in three starts as favourite this year and is one to consider
runners.spotlight: Regressive maiden who's been turned over as favourite on his last three starts; hasn't had much luck, though, and is one to consider for a yard in better form of late.

runners.name: Supernova Steps
runners.comment: Low mileage compared to most of these and better drawn this time, so a case could be made
runners.spotlight: Inclined to hang left in first-time cheekpieces when last seen three months ago and goes without headgear today; is low mileage compared to most of these and better drawn this time, so a case could be made.

runners.name: Global Effort
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate II
runners.comment: Ahead of better-fancied stablemate Alafdhal over C&D last Monday; holds each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Three course wins in the last ten months and finished ahead of better-fancied stablemate Alafdhal over C&D last Monday; holds each-way claims once more.

4:35.race_name: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap

runners.name: Swinging London
runners.comment: Three wins this winter and respectable third at Southwell (1m6f) last twice; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Three wins on Tapeta this winter, including two over 1m6f; only 2lb higher than for last success at Southwell in January and he's finished a respectable third there (1m6f) in last two starts; should go well.

runners.name: Banderas

prev_owners.owner: Oti Racing, Ballylinch Stud And Partner

runners.comment: Well held on hurdling debut latest but his last Flat run was a win over C&D; respected
runners.spotlight: Well held on hurdling debut at Doncaster in February but his last Flat run resulted in a win over C&D in December; that was a narrow success but he remains well handicapped on old form and is respected back on AW.

quotes.race: Boodles Darley Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Banderas is a nice stayer for the future. He has a great temperament and a nice pedigree. There's a lot to like about him. He wants cut in the ground. We wouldn't run him on good to firm - Michael Bell, trainer.

runners.name: Standbackandlook
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but he has a bit to prove after 200 days off; market should be informative
runners.spotlight: Raised his form to a new level when winning two in a row over C&D last summer but well held in final two runs last season; bit to prove after 200 days off and was well below form on his reappearance last spring.

runners.name: Forest Spirit
runners.owner: Mrs G Rowland Clark & J Oconnor
runners.comment: Two wins over 1m4f last month and she's open to more progress back up in trip; key player
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who came good with 1m4f wins at Southwell (by 5l) and Wolverhampton last month; escaped a penalty last time and is 8lb higher here but she's been strong at the finish in those races and is open to more progress back up in trip; big player.

runners.name: Liberated Lad
runners.comment: Last win was over 2m but he ran well over 1m at Doncaster last Sunday; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Recorded eighth AW win when scoring at Newcastle (2m) in January; no impact in four runs since but his sixth of 21 at Doncaster last Sunday was a creditable effort over 1m; not ruled out on big step back up in trip.

quotes.race: chelmsfordcityracecourse.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Liberated Lad has been a good, old servant. He's more of a turf horse than an all-weather horse. We'll probably give him a little holiday now and then try to win the stable staff race again at Newbury this year, as well as other amateur and apprentice races because he's just a yard favourite - Ben Brookhouse, trainer.

runners.name: Cogital
runners.comment: Back from a long absence with two heavy defeats and he has lots to prove; new headgear
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner, including six at a variety of trips on the Flat; well treated on old form but he's returned from a long absence with two heavy defeats and latest was at this track (1m4f) last month; new headgear is now tried and this veteran has lots to prove.

quotes.race: First Cafes Handicap
quotes.quote: Cogital usually runs over further, so I didn't want it to turn into a sprint and wanted to use his stamina up the straight. He's a lovely horse to be fair and ran well last time at Ascot. He was unlucky then and should have been a lot closer. I imagine he'll mix and match with the Flat and jumping - Jordan Williams, rider.

runners.name: Sydney Seabreeze
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Hoguenet Et Al
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden and he needs to find more back from 168 days off; been gelded
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden, who ran respectably in some staying handicaps in the autumn including when fourth behind an improver at Southwell (1m6f) in October; gelded since and mark continues to fall but he needs to find something extra on his return.

runners.name: Slowdownbarney
runners.comment: 0-15 but he's been knocking on the door at Dundalk (1m4f/2m) last twice; respected
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden but he's been knocking on the door at Dundalk (1m4f/2m) in his last two runs; up 3lb for latest second ten days ago but still unexposed as a stayer and should go well on this switch to Tapeta.

3:05.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap

runners.name: Phoenix Beach
runners.comment: New 7lb higher mark has kicked in now and he's drawn wide but has a good record over C&D
runners.spotlight: Has three wins and several near-misses to his name over C&D, having landed a weak handicap easily 16 days ago; his new 7lb higher mark has kicked in now and he's landed a wide stall but having experienced Mikkel Mortensen taking off 5lb will help.

runners.name: General Assembly
runners.comment: Made all when winning off 2lb lower over C&D last month; subsequent flop needs forgiving
runners.spotlight: Made all when winning off a 2lb lower mark over C&D last month and is drawn to attack in stall 1; a subsequent Chelmsford flop will need forgiving but that was his second poor effort in headgear and he goes without any aids here.

runners.name: Watermelon Sugar
runners.comment: Wins have come over 6f and he's high in the weights again; will need luck from stall 11
runners.spotlight: Wins have all come over 6f and he's high in the weights again following February's Lingfield victory off 7lb lower (since turned over at a short price on that course); is likely to be dropped in again from this stall and will need the breaks.

runners.name: Jojo Rabbit
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Xiii & Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Has won four of his nine starts over C&D and goes well first time out; needs considering
runners.spotlight: Has won four of his nine starts over C&D, while his record first time out down the years reads 22181 (successful on C&D comeback this time last season off 4lb higher after a five-month break); needs considering.

quotes.race: Watch Royal Ascot On Sky Sports Racing Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Jojo Rabbit got a nice lead this time rather than at Lingfield where he made the running and got hassled out of it. He's a nice type - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won first time out this year over 5f at Wolverhampton on Easter Monday off a mark of 72, having won his last race over the same course and distance last season. He's well handicapped on his best form. When we bought him he won first time out off 85 and then, I don't know for what reason, he never reached those sort of form levels again. I hope he can get back to them. 17-04-24

runners.name: Rosenpur
runners.comment: Two wins and a close third to his name in four runs over C&D; holds fair claims
runners.spotlight: Rarely disappoints round here and has two wins and a close third to his name in four runs over C&D; closely matched with General Assembly on latest running here and holds fair claims.

runners.name: Angle Land

prev_owners.owner: K Dasmal, A Rix, R Penney

runners.comment: Regressive mare who's only won one of her last 29 starts; others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Regressive mare who's only won one of her last 29 starts; hasn't had the breaks since the visor came off and is another 2lb lower but others make more appeal.

quotes.race: QuinBet Daily Free Bet Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Angle Land is a tough filly and that was a good performance with 10st 2lb on her back - Neil Callan, jockey.

runners.name: Aces Wild
runners.comment: Won this last season off a 6lb lower mark; has resumed in good form; goes on the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Won this last season off a 6lb lower mark, one of three C&D wins during the year; has resumed in good form, latterly as favourite behind three of these 23 days ago, and goes on the shortlist.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Maiden
quotes.quote: Aces Wild is a fast little horse and he's lightly raced and those kind of sprinters improve with age. We are hopeful he will keep the ball rolling - John McConnell, trainer

runners.name: Cabeza De Llave
runners.comment: Likes Chelmsford and doesn't have a great record here; wins have come after a recent run
runners.spotlight: Likes Chelmsford and doesn't have a great record round here; wins have all come after a recent outing, is drawn wide back from a break and high in the weights, so has a bit to overcome.

runners.name: Level Up
runners.comment: Likes it here; been running fairly well but others look stronger in a competitive handicap
runners.spotlight: Not as good now and has found winning tough in recent times; likes it here though and has been running fairly well but others look stronger in a competitive handicap.

runners.name: Walking On Clouds
runners.comment: Rarely drops below 6f now and has been done for toe on his last two runs over C&D
runners.spotlight: Rarely drops below 6f now and has been done for toe on last two runs over C&D; landed a gamble off a similar mark here late last year but would want to see market confidence coming back from a short break.

quotes.race: BetUK's Acca Club Â£5 Free Bet Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: We were confident today. I'd have liked a lead but Walking On Clouds got it very easy on the front end so I thought I'd keep it simple - Oliver Stammers, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Gustav Graves
runners.comment: Multiple C&D winner who's been running well during busy start to the year; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Multiple C&D winner who's been running well during a busy start to the year, twice finishing behind Phoenix Beach here last month; holds each-way claims once more.

3:35.race_name: BetMGM: It's Showtime Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Fighting Queen
runners.breeder: H H Shaikh Nasser Bin Hamad Al Khalifa
runners.comment: Big prices and was well held in two runs last month including over C&D
runners.spotlight: Well-held fifth of eight on C&D debut last month and was beaten 12l at another big price at Southwell (1m) ten days ago; opposable.

runners.name: Carron
runners.comment: Well held in sole 2yo run but that was on heavy ground; market informative on return
runners.spotlight: 135,000gns breeze-up purchase who finished well held on his heavy-ground debut at Newbury (7f) last autumn; should be capable of better and the market will be informative on return.

runners.name: Cosmic Spirit
runners.comment: Tailed off at massive prices in two runs this year and latest was over C&D
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at massive prices in two runs this year and latest was over C&D three weeks ago.

runners.name: Dubai Gold
runners.comment: Didn't show much when hooded for Southwell debut last month; needs a transformation
runners.spotlight: By Persian King and first foal of a Listed-placed 7f 2yo winner (RPR 93); hooded on Southwell debut (7f, AW; 11-1) last month when he missed the break and was always out the back; should know more this time but he needs a transformation.

runners.name: Excellent Believe
runners.comment: Promising second when 5-4 favourite on C&D debut last month; key player
runners.spotlight: 55,000euros yearling; 5-4 favourite on C&D debut in March and he made some good late headway to finish second behind his main market rival; that was promising and he should be more streetwise this time; key player.

stable_tour.quote: He put in a really good debut performance a fortnight ago when second at Wolverhampton. He was green as grass and got beat by what looks a high-quality horse of Sir Mark Prescott's [Warrior Mode]. He's well bred and should be winning his maiden before going into the handicap division. 02-04-25

runners.name: For What Its Worth
runners.comment: 8,000gns yearling; yard 0-11 in maidens last year and he could be one for later on
runners.spotlight: 8,000gns half-brother to winners Princess Valentina (Italian 5f-1m) and Kyrios (Polish 1m); dam maiden half-sister to winners Grand Son Of Calyx (6f 2yo/1m), Ghaawy (1m 2yo) and Monasada (1m2f); yard 0-11 in maidens last year and he could be one for later on.

runners.name: Hymnbook
runners.comment: 90,000gns yearling; not beaten far on Chelmsford debut and that form puts him in the mix
runners.spotlight: 90,000gns yearling; never-dangerous eighth of 12 on Chelmsford debut (7f) in November but he kept on well and was only beaten around 3l behind a useful prospect from the Gosden yard; that form puts him in the picture and he's open to progress on his return.

runners.name: Lkarama
runners.breeder: Scea Marmion Vauville & Skymarc Farm Inc
runners.comment: Held when favourite on Newcastle debut but he ran well for a long way; respected on return
runners.spotlight: 180,000gns yearling; held in fourth when 11-10 favourite on Newcastle debut (7f, Tapeta) in October but he ran well for a long way and that form has been boosted by the second and third since; should benefit from that experience and he's an interesting contender on his return.

runners.name: Reds And Wolves
runners.comment: 80,000gns 2yo; tongue tied on debut but he needs watching in the market
runners.spotlight: 27,000gns foal, 21,000gns yearling, 80,000gns 2yo; fifth foal; half-brother to 7f/1m winner Indiana Grey (including AW; RPR 73); dam placed 1m-1m2f (68), sister to useful 7f/1m winner Bishan Bedi; drawn wide with tongue-tie applied on debut but he needs watching in market.

runners.name: Road House
runners.comment: Blinkered on debut but yard is in good form and he needs checking in the betting
runners.spotlight: 15,000euros gelded half-brother to Spanish 7f/7.5f winner Brizna; dam placed 7f/1m 2yo (including AW; RPR 74), half-sister to useful winners Patentar (7f-1m1f) and Cavalry Charge (6f); blinkered on debut but yard is in good form; interesting to see how he figures in market.

runners.name: Brightlikeadiamond
runners.comment: 125-1 on Kempton debut (7f) 12 days ago and she finished tailed off
runners.spotlight: 125-1 on Kempton debut (7f) 12 days ago when tailed off in 11th of 12.

runners.name: Lambournghini
runners.comment: Made a low-key start at Lingfield ten days ago and needs to leave that form well behind
runners.spotlight: Got outpaced and was never involved when eighth of 12 at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack; 40-1) ten days ago; that was a low-key start and she needs to leave that form well behind.
