runners.name: Serious Look
runners.comment: Struggled badly in 2024 and has lots to prove after 188 days off
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful in his youth but he's lost his way and was beaten 9l or more in his five runs last year; continues to drop down the weights but has lots to prove after 188 days off; tongue-tie removed.

runners.name: River Alwen
runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford in November and was a creditable fourth at Lingfield latest; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Has ordinary strike-rate of 4-51 but his last win was at Chelmsford (1m2f) in November and he finished well for a close fourth at Lingfield (1m) two weeks ago; same mark here and has possibilities back up in trip.

quotes.race: Better Odds On Betfair Exchange Handicap
quotes.quote: River Alwen did well. He benefited from Newbury, he needed that run and was a bit fresh. He was dropped 2lb for that and this was a winnable race. I think ten furlongs is his trip but he will get more adaptable to middle-distances as he goes along. He should progress and improve again - Jamie Spencer, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice colt who ran a good race behind Fancy Man in the Listed Ascendant Stakes at Haydock in September. He is set to run at Newbury (3.25) on Friday. I've got a lot of time for him and he could step into Group company down the line but there are a lot of good handicaps he could be aimed at beforehand 16-04-21

runners.name: Star Of Jupiter
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo; won over C&D in February but was disappointing latest; mixed messages
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who won a classified event over C&D in February but was disappointing on handicap debut here two weeks later; bit to prove after that but still has potential and could bounce back in new headgear.

runners.name: Port Noir
runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm
runners.comment: Six-time course winner who was a close third here latest; dangerous back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Six of her ten wins have been at this track and last two were in October; has been generally consistent since then and she stayed on well to finish a close third here (8.6f) 11 days ago; on unchanged mark back up in trip and she's an interesting contender.

runners.name: Bitcoin Profit
runners.comment: Won here (8.6f) last April but she's been disappointing since and is now 1-15
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in 8.6f handicap here last April but she's generally struggled since; her reappearance fifth here (7f; hood added) last month was a bit more like it but she's now 1-15 and others are more convincing.

runners.name: Dash Power
runners.comment: Didn't fire at Southwell but he was in good form before that; dangerous back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Has had a win and four seconds this year but he didn't fire when favourite in Southwell handicap (7f) last time; needs to step up after that but his success came at this track (8.6f) and he could rediscover his spark back up in trip.

runners.name: Lhebayeb
runners.comment: Ended a long losing run when making all here latest; up 3lb but she's respected
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing run when making all off a reduced mark here (8.6f) 11 days ago; 3lb higher from wide draw this time but she remains well treated on old form and could make another bold bid.

runners.name: On Locust Point
runners.comment: Six-race maiden who has not really progressed and he needs improvement at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has not really progressed and was sixth of 12 in a classified event at Southwell (1m) last month; made some late headway in that race but he needs improvement at this new trip.

runners.name: Bay Of Naples

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Disappointing at Wolverhampton last time and he will need a good pace back at this trip
runners.spotlight: Creditable third at Southwell (1m3f) last month but he's not easy to predict and was beaten 8l at Wolverhampton (1m4f) last time; needs to bounce back and will need a good pace back at this trip; tongue-tie removed.

quotes.race: It's National Racehorse Week Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Bay Of Naples was suited by the way the race was run today. They got racing a long way out before coming back to him and he stayed on well ? he gets a bit further. Connor (Planas) hasn't panicked and gave him a lovely ride - Michael Herrington, trainer.

runners.name: Exceptionality
runners.comment: 17-race maiden who has yet to finish closer than 6l to the winner; opposable
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden who has yet to finish closer than 6l to the winner; opposable.

4:05.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap

runners.name: Bungle Bay
runners.comment: Little margin for error off this mark, but he tries hard and enters the equation
runners.spotlight: Made it 7-18 round here and 6-19 for Joe Leavy when winning over C&D off 2lb lower four weeks ago; there's little margin for error off this mark, coming from a wider stall, but he tries hard and enters the equation.

runners.name: Pennys Spirit
runners.comment: This is more realistic but would want to see support before considering her
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to two course winners who's finished well held in three starts over further, each time at a big price; this is more realistic but would want to see support before considering her.

runners.name: Smasher
runners.comment: Goes beyond 6f for the first time; will need to settle better than has often been the case
runners.spotlight: Little room for manoeuvre off this mark as he goes beyond sprint trips for the first time; will need to settle better than has often been the case if he's to see it out.

runners.name: Charlatan
runners.comment: This is just the second time he's run at shy of 1m since handicapping; needs a proper test
runners.spotlight: Not had much luck round here of late (nearly 1m) and this mark is surely within range when things fall his way; this is just the second time he's run at shy of 1m since handicapping, though, and he'll need a proper test.

runners.name: River Wharfe
runners.comment: Closely matched with Bungle Bay on C&D running last month; holds each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Will be happier back down in trip in a first-time visor (usually wears cheekpieces) and is closely matched with Bungle Bay on C&D running last month; holds each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: He holds entries at Brighton in two classified events - the 0-50 mile event on Wednesday and the 0-50 7f contest on Thursday. He's run at Brighton three times this season with one win, a third and a fourth, so hopefully he can go well again. 07-08-24

runners.name: Candy Warhol
runners.owner: Homecroft Wealth, Paul J Dixon & Partners
runners.comment: Drawn to attack again but is inconsistent; may not be as lucky this time under a penalty
runners.spotlight: Boasts a decent record over C&D and finally off the mark under a canny front-running ride here last Tuesday; drawn to attack again but lacks consistency and may not be as fortunate this time under a penalty.

runners.name: Ya Rayah
runners.comment: Made a fair start for his new yard (7f) a fortnight ago but now needs to build on it
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress and often hung left for Sean Woods, mainly over a bit further, and was gelded having been sold for 5,000gns last autumn; made a fair start for new yard (7f) a fortnight ago but needs to build on it.

runners.name: Bold Suitor

prev_owners.owner: N T Heung Yee Kuk Syndicate

runners.comment: Will likely be dropped in again from stall 12 and goes on the shortlist upped a fair 2lb
runners.spotlight: Back from a winter break in good form, chasing home a subsequent winner at Southwell before going in over C&D three weeks ago; will likely be dropped in again from stall 12 and goes on the shortlist upped a fair 2lb.

runners.name: So Chic

prev_owners.owner: Jj Culhane, C Rosier & G & L Woodward
Jj Culhane, C Rosier & G & L Woodward

runners.comment: This is stronger, off her revised mark back in handicap company, but she's respected
runners.spotlight: Made it two wins and two near-misses from five runs over C&D when things fell ideally in a 0-50 classified event four weeks ago; this is stronger, off her revised mark back in handicap company, but she's respected.

runners.name: Till It Shines

prev_owners.owner: Ms Caroline Instone & J S Moore

runners.comment: Down to earth from stall 11 behind Bold Suitor latest; is some way down the pecking order
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a 0-50 classified event over C&D last month before back down to earth from stall 11 behind Bold Suitor a week later; is some way down the pecking order.

stable_tour.quote: She's just lost her way a little bit at the minute. We gave her a little bit of a break. She's a big, strong filly. She has a nice page and she'll run probably in about a month's time. She has a little bit about her and we're treating her the right way because she still could be anything. I don't think she stayed at Brighton and I think she needs to come back in trip. The trip just found her out the last day but she'll have no problem winning. 04-07-24

runners.name: Diligent Henry
runners.comment: Better upped to this trip last autumn; this mark looks within range if ready to go again
runners.spotlight: Did better upped to this trip in blinkers/a visor last autumn, despite wandering under pressure each time; this mark looks within range if ready to go after six months off.

runners.name: The Cola Kid
runners.comment: Hit traffic early returned to 6f last time; that's best ignored but others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Has regressed in recent times and has been running in 0-50 company lately; hit traffic early returned to 6f last time and that's best ignored but others look stronger.

quotes.race: Summer Racing At Naas Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought he would need the run. He was a bit sick after the run the last day (tenth at Fairyhouse at the end of May) and I'd say he's probably better fresh. He stayed at it well. There is a race for him at Fairyhouse next Sunday, a six furlong 0-70 handicap. He's a good fun horse, very honest and stays going. Every time he ran up to now there was a problem with the draw but today everything worked to plan - Michael Brown, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Formerly with Michael Browne, he is another who joined us in September. It took us a while to get his head in front, but he did win at Newcastle (6f) in March and has run very well in defeat in each of his last two runs. I have given him a little break since then, but he is still on a competitive mark. 04-05-22

5:35.race_name: Weekly Â£5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Strategic Fortune
runners.comment: Last win was in February 2023 but he's run several good races since November; in the mix
runners.spotlight: His last win was in February 2023 but he's reached the frame in five of his last six runs including when second over C&D last time; remains feasibly treated and has possibilities if he gets a good pace and some luck; cheekpieces reapplied.

quotes.race: CorkRacecourse.ie Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Strategic Fortune was on his last chance today because he's been disappointing but he has ability. The little ease in the ground seemed to help him. He's often slow out of the stalls but the blinkers we fitted him with at Dundalk last week seemed to sharpen him up a bit. He didn't seem to handle it there at all and broke slow here again but it seemed to help because they went hard up front. Over 7f here on that ground it takes a bit of getting and it just seemed to fall apart. I mostly pre-train and break yearlings, I don't have that many runners for the track - John O'Shea, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has been with us for just over a year and has done well. He managed to win back-to-back 1m1Â½f races at Wolverhampton in the spring and has been enjoying a summer break ahead of a winter campaign. He loves Wolverhampton but that's down to the trip of 1m1Â½f they race over. Few places have races over that distance and it's spot on for him. I expect him to add to his wins in the new all-weather season. 23-09-22

runners.name: Desiderata
runners.comment: Lightly raced 5yo; won over C&D in January but he refused to race at Newcastle last time
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who found improvement when making a winning stable debut over C&D (classified event) in January; had an excuse when upped to 1m4f here two days later but he refused to race at Newcastle last month and comes with risks attached.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Classified Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's Desiderata's first run for us. We worked him up in Lambourn in the week and he went very well with a 60-rated horse so we expected him to run a nice race - Thomas Faulkner, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: The Pug
runners.comment: All three wins were in 2023 but he ran well over C&D last time and is not ruled out
runners.spotlight: All three wins in 2023 and has mixed record for new yard, but he ran well to finish third over C&D (cheekpieces reapplied) last month; ties in closely with Strategic Fortune on that form and has claims if he can back that up.

runners.name: Cryptos Dream
runners.comment: C&D winner in November and was a good third at Chelmsford on Thursday; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Her last win was off 1lb lower over C&D in November and she ran well when third at Chelmsford (1m2f) on Thursday; usually races prominently and she could make another bold bid from stall one.

runners.name: Trusty Scout
runners.comment: On workable mark but he returns after 389 days off and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Has claims on several runner-up efforts (1m3f/1m4f) early last year but his last run was 13 months ago and this looks competitive back in trip on his comeback; others preferred.

runners.name: Sir Laurence Graff

prev_owners.owner: White Birch Farm, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor

runners.comment: Has gone close in four of his last five including over 8.6f here last Monday; respected
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner who has gone close in four of his last five runs including in a classified event here (8.6f; cheekpieces added) last Monday; on unchanged mark back in a handicap and he's respected back up in trip.

runners.name: Possible Ambition
runners.comment: Well down the field in last five runs including in a classified event here last Monday
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over C&D on stable debut 14 months ago but well down the field all five starts since including in a classified event here last Monday; opposable.

quotes.race: Leicester Racecourse Ideal Christmas Party Venue Selling Stakes
quotes.quote: I thought I was beat. The second horse completely stopped and Possible Ambition got there just inside the furlong and I didn't want to take the momentum back off him because he was waiting on the other horse a little. He won in the end, which is all that matters. He acts on this ground, which is a big help, and it's quite attritional out there -Jason Hart, jockey.

runners.name: Mykonos St John
runners.breeder: T K & Mrs P A Knox
runners.comment: Won here in October but unplaced in all 12 starts since; needs a big turnaround
runners.spotlight: Won off 7lb higher here (8.6f) in October, but unplaced in all 12 starts since, including when last of 11 over C&D last month; has lots to prove and he needs a big turnaround.

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com/marketmovers Handicap
quotes.quote: There was plenty of pace in the race so I bided my time out of the wind down the back straight and Mykonos St John came through at the end. Gelding has been the making of him - Saffie Osborne, jockey.

runners.name: Pop Noodle
runners.comment: Placed over C&D last time but he's now 0-12 and needs to find more back in a handicap
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with a fair third over C&D (classified event) in February but that took his record to 0-12 and he needs to find more to make a big impact back in a handicap.

runners.name: Dors Delight
runners.comment: Nine-race maiden who has struggled in her last two runs and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who showed promise with her third at Chelmsford (1m) in December but she's struggled in both runs since and has plenty to prove again.

10:16.race_name: Central Bank Ashland Stakes (Grade 1) (3yo Fillies) (Main Track) (Dirt)

runners.name: Look Forward
runners.breeder: Woods Edge Farm Llc & Ballyfair Bloodstock
runners.comment: Ought to be competitive; narrow winner three months ago.
runners.spotlight: This daughter of Bolt d'Oro looks the part on breeding and two from four in her career so far; got the job done in a stakes by a short head (Santa Anita) in January; must be high on list.

runners.name: La Cara
runners.comment: Likely to be involved; good effort when runner-up 34 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Has chalked up three wins from her last five; won a stakes two months ago; problems at the start (problems in the gate) when on the premises, finishing runner-up at 11-10 (Gulfstream Park) five weeks ago in a Grade 2; chance.

runners.name: Supa Speed
runners.owner: Flying Dutchmen Breeding And Racing Llc

prev_owners.owner: Flying Dutchmen Breeding And Racing LLC

runners.comment: Close-up runner-up last month; wins-runs record of 3-6.
runners.spotlight: Ran well in a stakes over Christmas; on target twice in her last six outings; not beaten far (Santa Anita) last month in a Grade 3; running on dirt for the first time.

runners.name: Muhimma
runners.comment: She's worth a go; winner of three of her four runs to date.
runners.spotlight: Looks the part on breeding (by Munnings) and has won three of her four career starts; got the job done in a Grade 2 by 1l (Aqueduct) in December; she's a serious player.

runners.name: Take Charge Milady
runners.owner: James Ball, Magdalena Racing & Kenneth Rhodes
runners.comment: Despite that Oaklawn Park success, others have more pressing claims.
runners.spotlight: Has won two of her five career starts; was well on top at the line in January at Oaklawn Park in a stakes; despite that Oaklawn Park success, passed over.

runners.name: Amarth
runners.comment: Not beaten far five weeks ago; wins-runs record of 2-5.
runners.spotlight: Went off 22-1 when good second 34 days ago at Aqueduct in a stakes; has won here previously; has chalked up two wins from her last four.

runners.name: Admit
runners.comment: Solid effort to finish third last month; wins-runs record of 2-6.
runners.spotlight: Producing consistent form; on target twice in her last four outings; produced an encouraging effort (third of 11, beaten 3l) last month at Turfway Park in a stakes.
